[SHK] Nay but this dotage of our general 's
[SHK] O'erflows the measure those his goodly eyes
[SHK] That o'er the files and musters of the war
[SHK] Have glow 'd like plated Mars now bend now turn
[SHK] The office and devotion of their view
[SHK] Upon a tawny front his captain 's heart
[SHK] Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst
[SHK] The buckles on his breast reneges all temper
[SHK] And is become the bellows and the fan
[SHK] To cool a gipsy 's lust
[SHK] Look where they come
[SHK] Take but good note and you shall see in him
[SHK] The triple pillar of the world transform 'd
[SHK] Into a strumpet 's fool behold and see
[SHK] If it be love indeed tell me how much
[SHK] There 's beggary in the love that can be reckon 'd
[SHK] I 'll set a bourn how far to be beloved
[SHK] Then must thou needs find out new heaven new earth
[SHK] News my good lord from Rome
[SHK] Grates me the sum
[SHK] Nay hear them Antony

[SHK] Perform 't or else we damn thee

[SHK] Of the ranged empire fall Here is my space

[SHK] And such a twain can do't in which I bind
[SHK] On pain of punishment the world to weet

[SHK] mettle in death which commits some loving act upon
[SHK] her she hath such a celerity in dying

[SHK] out there are members to make new If there were

[SHK] Our great competitor from Alexandria

[SHK] Than Cleopatra nor the queen of Ptolemy
[SHK] More womanly than he hardly gave audience or
[SHK] Vouchsafed to think he had partners you shall find there
[SHK] A man who is the abstract of all faults
[SHK] That all men follow
[SHK] I must not think there are
[SHK] Evils enow to darken all his goodness
[SHK] His faults in him seem as the spots of heaven
[SHK] More fiery by night 's blackness hereditary
[SHK] Rather than purchased what he can not change
[SHK] Than what he chooses
[SHK] You are too indulgent Let us grant it is not
[SHK] Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolemy
[SHK] To give a kingdom for a mirth to sit
[SHK] And keep the turn of tippling with a slave
[SHK] To reel the streets at noon and stand the buffet
[SHK] With knaves that smell of sweat say this
[SHK] becomes him --
[SHK] As his composure must be rare indeed
[SHK] Whom these things can not blemish -- yet must Antony
[SHK] No way excuse his soils when we do bear
[SHK] So great weight in his lightness If he fill 'd
[SHK] His vacancy with his voluptuousness
[SHK] Full surfeits and the dryness of his bones
[SHK] Call on him for't but to confound such time
[SHK] That drums him from his sport and speaks as loud
[SHK] As his own state and ours -- 't is to be chid
[SHK] As we rate boys who being mature in knowledge
[SHK] Pawn their experience to their present pleasure
[SHK] And so rebel to judgment
[SHK] Here 's more news
[SHK] Thy biddings have been done and every hour
[SHK] Most noble Caesar shalt thou have report
[SHK] How 't is abroad Pompey is strong at sea
[SHK] And it appears he is beloved of those
[SHK] That only have fear 'd Caesar to the ports
[SHK] The discontents repair and men 's reports
[SHK] Give him much wrong 'd
[SHK] I should have known no less
[SHK] It hath been taught us from the primal state
[SHK] That he which is was wish 'd until he were
[SHK] And the ebb 'd man ne'er loved till ne'er worth love
[SHK] Comes dear 'd by being lack 'd This common body
[SHK] Like to a vagabond flag upon the stream
[SHK] Goes to and back lackeying the varying tide
[SHK] To rot itself with motion
[SHK] Caesar I bring thee word
[SHK] Menecrates and Menas famous pirates
[SHK] Make the sea serve them which they ear and wound
[SHK] With keels of every kind many hot inroads
[SHK] They make in Italy the borders maritime
[SHK] Lack blood to think o n't and flush youth revolt
[SHK] No vessel can peep forth but 't is as soon
[SHK] Taken as seen for Pompey 's name strikes more
[SHK] Than could his war resisted
[SHK] Antony
[SHK] Leave thy lascivious wassails When thou once
[SHK] Wast beaten from Modena where thou slew'st
[SHK] Hirtius and Pansa consuls at thy heel
[SHK] Did famine follow whom thou fought'st against
[SHK] Though daintily brought up with patience more
[SHK] Than savages could suffer thou didst drink
[SHK] The stale of horses and the gilded puddle
[SHK] Which beasts would cough at thy palate then did deign
[SHK] The roughest berry on the rudest hedge
[SHK] Yea like the stag when snow the pasture sheets
[SHK] The barks of trees thou browsed'st on the Alps
[SHK] It is reported thou didst eat strange flesh
[SHK] Which some did die to look on and all this --
[SHK] It wounds thine honour that I speak it now --
[SHK] Was borne so like a soldier that thy cheek
[SHK] So much as lank 'd not
[SHK] 'T is pity of him
[SHK] Let his shames quickly

[SHK] For so he calls me now I feed myself
[SHK] With most delicious poison Think on me
[SHK] That am with Phoebus amorous pinches black
[SHK] And wrinkled deep in time Broad-fronted Caesar
[SHK] When thou wast here above the ground I was
[SHK] A morsel for a monarch and great Pompey
[SHK] Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow
[SHK] There would he anchor his aspect and die
[SHK] With looking on his life
[SHK] Sovereign of Egypt hail
[SHK] How much unlike art thou Mark Antony
[SHK] Yet coming from him that great medicine hath
[SHK] With his tinct gilded thee
[SHK] How goes it with my brave Mark Antony
[SHK] Last thing he did dear queen
[SHK] He kiss 'd -- the last of many doubled kisses --
[SHK] This orient pearl His speech sticks in my heart
[SHK] Mine ear must pluck it thence
[SHK] 'Good friend quoth he
[SHK] 'Say the firm Roman to great Egypt sends
[SHK] This treasure of an oyster at whose foot
[SHK] To mend the petty present I will piece
[SHK] Her opulent throne with kingdoms all the east
[SHK] Say thou shall call her mistress So he nodded
[SHK] And soberly did mount an arm-gaunt steed
[SHK] Who neigh 'd so high that what I would have spoke
[SHK] Was beastly dumb 'd by him
[SHK] What was he sad or merry
[SHK] Like to the time o the year between the extremes
[SHK] Of hot and cold he was nor sad nor merry
[SHK] O well-divided disposition Note him
[SHK] Note him good Charmian 't is the man but note him
[SHK] He was not sad for he would shine on those
[SHK] That make their looks by his he was not merry
[SHK] Which seem 'd to tell them his remembrance lay
[SHK] In Egypt with his joy but between both
[SHK] O heavenly mingle Be'st thou sad or merry
[SHK] The violence of either thee becomes
[SHK] So does it no man else Met'st thou my posts
[SHK] Ay madam twenty several messengers
[SHK] Why do you send so thick
[SHK] Who 's born that day

[SHK] The winds were love-sick with them the oars were silver
[SHK] Which to the tune of flutes kept stroke and made
[SHK] The water which they beat to follow faster

[SHK] To glow the delicate cheeks which they did cool

[SHK] Sir this should be answer 'd

[SHK] I have told him Lepidus was grown too cruel
[SHK] That he his high authority abused
[SHK] And did deserve his change for what I have conquer 'd
[SHK] I grant him part but then in his Armenia
[SHK] And other of his conquer 'd kingdoms I
[SHK] Demand the like
[SHK] He 'll never yield to that
[SHK] Nor must not then be yielded to in this
[SHK] Hail Caesar and my lord hail most dear Caesar
[SHK] That ever I should call thee castaway
[SHK] You have not call 'd me so nor have you cause
[SHK] Why have you stol'n upon us thus You come not
[SHK] Like Caesar 's sister the wife of Antony
[SHK] Should have an army for an usher and
[SHK] The neighs of horse to tell of her approach
[SHK] Long ere she did appear the trees by the way
[SHK] Should have borne men and expectation fainted
[SHK] Longing for what it had not nay the dust
[SHK] Should have ascended to the roof of heaven
[SHK] Raised by your populous troops but you are come
[SHK] A market-maid to Rome and have prevented
[SHK] The ostentation of our love which left unshown
[SHK] Is often left unloved we should have met you
[SHK] By sea and land supplying every stage
[SHK] With an augmented greeting
[SHK] Good my lord
[SHK] To come thus was I not constrain 'd but did
[SHK] On my free will My lord Mark Antony
[SHK] Hearing that you prepared for war acquainted
[SHK] My grieved ear withal whereon I begg 'd
[SHK] His pardon for return
[SHK] Which soon he granted
[SHK] Being an obstruct 'tween his lust and him
[SHK] Do not say so my lord
[SHK] I have eyes upon him
[SHK] And his affairs come to me on the wind
[SHK] Where is he now
[SHK] My lord in Athens
[SHK] No my most wronged sister Cleopatra
[SHK] Hath nodded him to her He hath given his empire
[SHK] Up to a whore who now are levying
[SHK] The kings o the earth for war he hath assembled
[SHK] Bocchus the king of Libya Archelaus
[SHK] Of Cappadocia Philadelphos king
[SHK] Of Paphlagonia the Thracian king Adallas
[SHK] King Malchus of Arabia King of Pont
[SHK] Herod of Jewry Mithridates king
[SHK] Of Comagene Polemon and Amyntas
[SHK] The kings of Mede and Lycaonia
[SHK] With a more larger list of sceptres
[SHK] Ay me most wretched
[SHK] That have my heart parted betwixt two friends
[SHK] That do afflict each other
[SHK] Welcome hither
[SHK] Your letters did withhold our breaking forth
[SHK] Till we perceived both how you were wrong led
[SHK] And we in negligent danger Cheer your heart
[SHK] Be you not troubled with the time which drives
[SHK] O'er your content these strong necessities
[SHK] But let determined things to destiny
[SHK] Hold unbewail 'd their way Welcome to Rome
[SHK] Nothing more dear to me You are abused
[SHK] Beyond the mark of thought and the high gods
[SHK] To do you justice make them ministers
[SHK] Of us and those that love you Best of comfort
[SHK] And ever welcome to us
[SHK] Welcome lady
[SHK] Welcome dear madam
[SHK] Each heart in Rome does love and pity you
[SHK] Only the adulterous Antony most large
[SHK] In his abominations turns you off
[SHK] And gives his potent regiment to a trull
[SHK] That noises it against us
[SHK] Is it so sir
[SHK] Most certain Sister welcome pray you
[SHK] Be ever known to patience my dear'st sister
[SHK] I will be even with thee doubt it not
[SHK] But why why why
[SHK] Thou hast forspoke my being in these wars
[SHK] And say'st it is not fit
[SHK] Well is it is it
[SHK] If not denounced against us why should not we
[SHK] Be there in person
[SHK] If we should serve with horse and mares together
[SHK] The horse were merely lost the mares would bear
[SHK] A soldier and his horse
[SHK] What is't you say
[SHK] Your presence needs must puzzle Antony
[SHK] Take from his heart take from his brain
[SHK] from 's time
[SHK] What should not then be spared He is already
[SHK] Traduced for levity and 't is said in Rome
[SHK] That Photinus an eunuch and your maids
[SHK] Manage this war
[SHK] Sink Rome and their tongues rot
[SHK] That speak against us A charge we bear i the war
[SHK] And as the president of my kingdom will
[SHK] Appear there for a man Speak not against it
[SHK] I will not stay behind
[SHK] Nay I have done
[SHK] Here comes the emperor
[SHK] Is it not strange Canidius
[SHK] That from Tarentum and Brundusium
[SHK] He could so quickly cut the Ionian sea
[SHK] And take in Toryne You have heard o n't sweet
[SHK] Celerity is never more admired
[SHK] Than by the negligent
[SHK] A good rebuke
[SHK] Which might have well becomed the best of men
[SHK] To taunt at slackness Canidius we
[SHK] Will fight with him by sea
[SHK] By sea what else
[SHK] Why will my lord do so
[SHK] For that he dares us to't
[SHK] So hath my lord dared him to single fight
[SHK] Ay and to wage this battle at Pharsalia
[SHK] Where Caesar fought with Pompey but these offers
[SHK] Which serve not for his vantage be shakes off
[SHK] And so should you
[SHK] Your ships are not well mann 'd
[SHK] Your mariners are muleters reapers people
[SHK] Ingross 'd by swift impress in Caesar 's fleet
[SHK] Are those that often have 'gainst Pompey fought
[SHK] Their ships are yare yours heavy no disgrace
[SHK] Shall fall you for refusing him at sea
[SHK] Being prepared for land
[SHK] By sea by sea
[SHK] Most worthy sir you therein throw away
[SHK] The absolute soldiership you have by land
[SHK] Distract your army which doth most consist
[SHK] Of war-mark 'd footmen leave unexecuted
[SHK] Your own renowned knowledge quite forego
[SHK] The way which promises assurance and
[SHK] Give up yourself merely to chance and hazard
[SHK] From firm security
[SHK] I 'll fight at sea
[SHK] I have sixty sails Caesar none better
[SHK] Our overplus of shipping will we burn
[SHK] And with the rest full-mann 'd from the head of Actium
[SHK] Beat the approaching Caesar But if we fail
[SHK] We then can do't at land
[SHK] Thy business
[SHK] The news is true my lord he is descried

[SHK] Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land
[SHK] And our twelve thousand horse We 'll to our ship
[SHK] Away my Thetis
[SHK] How now worthy soldier

[SHK] Trust not to rotten planks do you misdoubt

[SHK] And the Phoenicians go a-ducking we
[SHK] Have used to conquer standing on the earth
[SHK] And fighting foot to foot
[SHK] Well well away

[SHK] And we are women 's men

[SHK] Publicola and Caelius are for sea

[SHK] Carries beyond belief

[SHK] Beguiled all spies

[SHK] My lord

[SHK] With very ignorance we have kiss 'd away
[SHK] Kingdoms and provinces

[SHK] On our side like the token 'd pestilence
[SHK] Where death is sure Yon ribaudred nag of Egypt --

[SHK] When vantage like a pair of twins appear 'd
[SHK] Both as the same or rather ours the elder
[SHK] The breese upon her like a cow in June
[SHK] Hoists sails and flies
[SHK] That I beheld
[SHK] Mine eyes did sicken at the sight and could not
[SHK] Endure a further view
[SHK] She once being loof 'd
[SHK] The noble ruin of her magic Antony
[SHK] Claps on his sea-wing and like a doting mallard
[SHK] Leaving the fight in height flies after her
[SHK] I never saw an action of such shame
[SHK] Experience manhood honour ne'er before
[SHK] Did violate so itself

[SHK] Most grossly by his own

[SHK] To our confusion
[SHK] O is't come to this
[SHK] I found you as a morsel cold upon

[SHK] Luxuriously pick 'd out for I am sure
[SHK] Though you can guess what temperance should be
[SHK] You know not what it is

[SHK] To let a fellow that will take rewards

[SHK] Not what he knew I was he makes me angry
[SHK] And at this time most easy 't is to do't
[SHK] When my good stars that were my former guides
[SHK] Have empty left their orbs and shot their fires
[SHK] Into the abysm of hell If he mislike
[SHK] My speech and what is done tell him he has

[SHK] Hence with thy stripes begone

[SHK] Is now eclipsed and it portends alone

[SHK] I must stay his time
[SHK] To flatter Caesar would you mingle eyes
[SHK] With one that ties his points
[SHK] Not know me yet
[SHK] Cold-hearted toward me
[SHK] Ah dear if I be so
[SHK] From my cold heart let heaven engender hail
[SHK] And poison it in the source and the first stone
[SHK] Drop in my neck as it determines so
[SHK] Dissolve my life The next Caesarion smite
[SHK] Till by degrees the memory of my womb

[SHK] By the discandying of this pelleted storm
[SHK] Lie graveless till the flies and gnats of Nile
[SHK] Have buried them for prey
[SHK] I am satisfied
[SHK] Caesar sits down in Alexandria where
[SHK] I will oppose his fate Our force by land
[SHK] Hath nobly held our sever 'd navy too
[SHK] Have knit again and fleet threatening most sea-like
[SHK] Where hast thou been my heart Dost thou hear lady
[SHK] If from the field I shall return once more

[SHK] I and my sword will earn our chronicle
[SHK] There 's hope i n't yet
[SHK] That 's my brave lord
[SHK] I will be treble-sinew 'd hearted breathed
[SHK] And fight maliciously for when mine hours
[SHK] Were nice and lucky men did ransom lives
[SHK] Of me for jests but now I 'll set my teeth
[SHK] And send to darkness all that stop me Come
[SHK] Let 's have one other gaudy night call to me
[SHK] All my sad captains fill our bowls once more
[SHK] Let 's mock the midnight bell
[SHK] It is my birth-day
[SHK] I had thought to have held it poor but since my lord
[SHK] Is Antony again I will be Cleopatra
[SHK] We will yet do well
[SHK] Call all his noble captains to my lord
[SHK] Do so we 'll speak to them and to-night I 'll force
[SHK] The wine peep through their scars Come on my queen
[SHK] There 's sap i n't yet The next time I do fight
[SHK] I 'll make death love me for I will contend
[SHK] Even with his pestilent scythe
[SHK] Now he 'll outstare the lightning To be furious
[SHK] Is to be frighted out of fear and in that mood

[SHK] All dead
[SHK] Caesar thy thoughts
[SHK] Touch their effects in this thyself art coming
[SHK] To see perform 'd the dreaded act which thou
[SHK] So sought'st to hinder
[SHK] O sir you are too sure an augurer
[SHK] That you did fear is done
[SHK] Bravest at the last
[SHK] She levell 'd at our purposes and being royal
[SHK] Took her own way The manner of their deaths
[SHK] I do not see them bleed
[SHK] Who was last with them
[SHK] A simple countryman that brought her figs
[SHK] This was his basket
[SHK] Poison 'd then
[SHK] O Caesar
[SHK] This Charmian lived but now she stood and spake
[SHK] I found her trimming up the diadem
[SHK] On her dead mistress tremblingly she stood
[SHK] And on the sudden dropp 'd
[SHK] O noble weakness
[SHK] If they had swallow 'd poison 'twould appear
[SHK] By external swelling but she looks like sleep
[SHK] As she would catch another Antony
[SHK] In her strong toil of grace
[SHK] Here on her breast
[SHK] There is a vent of blood and something blown
[SHK] The like is on her arm
[SHK] This is an aspic 's trail and these fig-leaves
[SHK] Have slime upon them such as the aspic leaves
[SHK] Upon the caves of Nile
[SHK] Most probable
[SHK] That so she died for her physician tells me
[SHK] She hath pursued conclusions infinite
[SHK] Of easy ways to die Take up her bed
[SHK] And bear her women from the monument
[SHK] She shall be buried by her Antony
[SHK] No grave upon the earth shall clip in it
[SHK] A pair so famous High events as these
[SHK] Strike those that make them and their story is
[SHK] No less in pity than his glory which
[SHK] Brought them to be lamented Our army shall
[SHK] In solemn show attend this funeral
[SHK] And then to Rome Come Dolabella see
[SHK] High order in this great solemnity
[SHK] Now fair Hippolyta our nuptial hour
[SHK] Draws on apace four happy days bring in
[SHK] Another moon but O methinks how slow
[SHK] This old moon wanes she lingers my desires
[SHK] Like to a step-dame or a dowager
[SHK] Long withering out a young man revenue
[SHK] Four days will quickly steep themselves in night
[SHK] Four nights will quickly dream away the time
[SHK] And then the moon like to a silver bow
[SHK] New-bent in heaven shall behold the night
[SHK] Of our solemnities
[SHK] Go Philostrate
[SHK] Stir up the Athenian youth to merriments
[SHK] Awake the pert and nimble spirit of mirth
[SHK] Turn melancholy forth to funerals
[SHK] The pale companion is not for our pomp
[SHK] Hippolyta I woo 'd thee with my sword
[SHK] And won thy love doing thee injuries
[SHK] But I will wed thee in another key
[SHK] With pomp with triumph and with revelling
[SHK] Happy be Theseus our renowned duke
[SHK] Thanks good Egeus what 's the news with thee
[SHK] Full of vexation come I with complaint
[SHK] Against my child my daughter Hermia
[SHK] Stand forth Demetrius My noble lord
[SHK] This man hath my consent to marry her
[SHK] Stand forth Lysander and my gracious duke
[SHK] This man hath bewitch 'd the bosom of my child
[SHK] Thou thou Lysander thou hast given her rhymes
[SHK] And interchanged love-tokens with my child
[SHK] Thou hast by moonlight at her window sung
[SHK] With feigning voice verses of feigning love
[SHK] And stolen the impression of her fantasy
[SHK] With bracelets of thy hair rings gawds conceits
[SHK] Knacks trifles nosegays sweetmeats messengers
[SHK] Of strong prevailment in unharden 'd youth
[SHK] With cunning hast thou filch 'd my daughter 's heart
[SHK] Turn 'd her obedience which is due to me
[SHK] To stubborn harshness and my gracious duke
[SHK] Be it so she will not here before your grace
[SHK] Consent to marry with Demetrius
[SHK] I beg the ancient privilege of Athens
[SHK] As she is mine I may dispose of her
[SHK] Which shall be either to this gentleman
[SHK] Or to her death according to our law
[SHK] Immediately provided in that case
[SHK] What say you Hermia be advised fair maid
[SHK] To you your father should be as a god
[SHK] One that composed your beauties yea and one
[SHK] To whom you are but as a form in wax
[SHK] By him imprinted and within his power
[SHK] To leave the figure or disfigure it
[SHK] Demetrius is a worthy gentleman
[SHK] So is Lysander
[SHK] In himself he is
[SHK] But in this kind wanting your father 's voice
[SHK] The other must be held the worthier
[SHK] I would my father look 'd but with my eyes
[SHK] Rather your eyes must with his judgment look
[SHK] I do entreat your grace to pardon me
[SHK] I know not by what power I am made bold
[SHK] Nor how it may concern my modesty
[SHK] In such a presence here to plead my thoughts
[SHK] But I beseech your grace that I may know
[SHK] The worst that may befall me in this case
[SHK] If I refuse to wed Demetrius
[SHK] Either to die the death or to abjure
[SHK] For ever the society of men
[SHK] Therefore fair Hermia question your desires
[SHK] Know of your youth examine well your blood
[SHK] Whether if you yield not to your father 's choice
[SHK] You can endure the livery of a nun
[SHK] For aye to be in shady cloister mew 'd
[SHK] To live a barren sister all your life
[SHK] Chanting faint hymns to the cold fruitless moon
[SHK] Thrice-blessed they that master so their blood
[SHK] To undergo such maiden pilgrimage
[SHK] But earthlier happy is the rose distill 'd
[SHK] Than that which withering on the virgin thorn
[SHK] Grows lives and dies in single blessedness
[SHK] So will I grow so live so die my lord
[SHK] Ere I will my virgin patent up
[SHK] Unto his lordship whose unwished yoke
[SHK] My soul consents not to give sovereignty
[SHK] Take time to pause and by the nest new moon --
[SHK] The sealing-day betwixt my love and me
[SHK] For everlasting bond of fellowship --
[SHK] Upon that day either prepare to die
[SHK] For disobedience to your father 's will
[SHK] Or else to wed Demetrius as he would
[SHK] Or on Diana 's altar to protest
[SHK] For aye austerity and single life
[SHK] Relent sweet Hermia and Lysander yield
[SHK] Thy crazed title to my certain right
[SHK] You have her father 's love Demetrius
[SHK] Let me have Hermia 's do you marry him
[SHK] Scornful Lysander true he hath my love
[SHK] And what is mine my love shall render him
[SHK] And she is mine and all my right of her
[SHK] I do estate unto Demetrius
[SHK] I am my lord as well derived as he
[SHK] As well possess 'd my love is more than his
[SHK] My fortunes every way as fairly rank 'd
[SHK] If not with vantage as Demetrius
[SHK] And which is more than all these boasts can be
[SHK] I am beloved of beauteous Hermia
[SHK] Why should not I then prosecute my right
[SHK] Demetrius I 'll avouch it to his head
[SHK] Made love to Nedar 's daughter Helena
[SHK] And won her soul and she sweet lady dotes
[SHK] Devoutly dotes dotes in idolatry
[SHK] Upon this spotted and inconstant man
[SHK] I must confess that I have heard so much
[SHK] And with Demetrius thought to have spoke thereof
[SHK] But being over-full of self-affairs
[SHK] My mind did lose it But Demetrius come
[SHK] And come Egeus you shall go with me
[SHK] I have some private schooling for you both
[SHK] For you fair Hermia look you arm yourself
[SHK] To fit your fancies to your father 's will
[SHK] Or else the law of Athens yields you up --
[SHK] Which by no means we may extenuate --
[SHK] To death or to a vow of single life
[SHK] Come my Hippolyta what cheer my love
[SHK] Demetrius and Egeus go along
[SHK] I must employ you in some business
[SHK] Against our nuptial and confer with you
[SHK] Of something nearly that concerns yourselves
[SHK] With duty and desire we follow you
[SHK] How now my love why is your cheek so pale
[SHK] How chance the roses there do fade so fast
[SHK] Belike for want of rain which I could well
[SHK] Beteem them from the tempest of my eyes
[SHK] Ay me for aught that I could ever read
[SHK] Could ever hear by tale or history
[SHK] The course of true love never did run smooth
[SHK] But either it was different in blood --
[SHK] O cross too high to be enthrall 'd to low
[SHK] Or else misgraffed in respect of years --
[SHK] O spite too old to be engaged to young
[SHK] Or else it stood upon the choice of friends --
[SHK] O hell to choose love by another 's eyes
[SHK] Or if there were a sympathy in choice
[SHK] War death or sickness did lay siege to it
[SHK] Making it momentany as a sound
[SHK] Swift as a shadow short as any dream
[SHK] Brief as the lightning in the collied night
[SHK] That in a spleen unfolds both heaven and earth
[SHK] And ere a man hath power to say 'Behold
[SHK] The jaws of darkness do devour it up
[SHK] So quick bright things come to confusion
[SHK] If then true lovers have been ever cross 'd
[SHK] It stands as an edict in destiny
[SHK] Then let us teach our trial patience
[SHK] Because it is a customary cross
[SHK] As due to love as thoughts and dreams and sighs
[SHK] Wishes and tears poor fancy 's followers
[SHK] A good persuasion therefore hear me Hermia
[SHK] I have a widow aunt a dowager
[SHK] Of great revenue and she hath no child
[SHK] From Athens is her house remote seven leagues
[SHK] And she respects me as her only son
[SHK] There gentle Hermia may I marry thee
[SHK] And to that place the sharp Athenian law
[SHK] Can not pursue us If thou lovest me then
[SHK] Steal forth thy father 's house to-morrow night
[SHK] And in the wood a league without the town
[SHK] Where I did meet thee once with Helena
[SHK] To do observance to a morn of May
[SHK] There will I stay for thee
[SHK] My good Lysander
[SHK] I swear to thee by Cupid 's strongest bow
[SHK] By his best arrow with the golden head
[SHK] By the simplicity of Venus doves
[SHK] By that which knitteth souls and prospers loves
[SHK] And by that fire which burn 'd the Carthage queen
[SHK] When the false Troyan under sail was seen
[SHK] By all the vows that ever men have broke
[SHK] In number more than ever women spoke
[SHK] In that same place thou hast appointed me
[SHK] To-morrow truly will I meet with thee
[SHK] Keep promise love Look here comes Helena
[SHK] God speed fair Helena whither away
[SHK] Call you me fair that fair again unsay
[SHK] Demetrius loves your fair O happy fair
[SHK] Your eyes are lode-stars and your tongue 's sweet air
[SHK] More tuneable than lark to shepherd 's ear
[SHK] When wheat is green when hawthorn buds appear
[SHK] Sickness is catching O were favour so
[SHK] Yours would I catch fair Hermia ere I go
[SHK] My ear should catch your voice my eye your eye
[SHK] My tongue should catch your tongue 's sweet melody
[SHK] Were the world mine Demetrius being bated
[SHK] The rest I 'd give to be to you translated
[SHK] O teach me how you look and with what art
[SHK] You sway the motion of Demetrius heart
[SHK] I frown upon him yet he loves me still
[SHK] O that your frowns would teach my smiles such skill
[SHK] I give him curses yet he gives me love
[SHK] O that my prayers could such affection move
[SHK] The more I hate the more he follows me
[SHK] The more I love the more he hateth me
[SHK] His folly Helena is no fault of mine
[SHK] None but your beauty would that fault were mine
[SHK] Take comfort he no more shall see my face
[SHK] Lysander and myself will fly this place
[SHK] Before the time I did Lysander see
[SHK] Seem 'd Athens as a paradise to me
[SHK] O then what graces in my love do dwell
[SHK] That he hath turn 'd a heaven unto a hell
[SHK] Helen to you our minds we will unfold
[SHK] To-morrow night when Phoebe doth behold
[SHK] Her silver visage in the watery glass
[SHK] Decking with liquid pearl the bladed grass
[SHK] A time that lovers flights doth still conceal
[SHK] Through Athens gates have we devised to steal
[SHK] And in the wood where often you and I
[SHK] Upon faint primrose-beds were wont to lie
[SHK] Emptying our bosoms of their counsel sweet
[SHK] There my Lysander and myself shall meet
[SHK] And thence from Athens turn away our eyes
[SHK] To seek new friends and stranger companies
[SHK] Farewell sweet playfellow pray thou for us
[SHK] And good luck grant thee thy Demetrius
[SHK] Keep word Lysander we must starve our sight
[SHK] From lovers food till morrow deep midnight
[SHK] I will my Hermia
[SHK] Helena adieu
[SHK] As you on him Demetrius dote on you
[SHK] How happy some o'er other some can be
[SHK] Through Athens I am thought as fair as she
[SHK] But what of that Demetrius thinks not so
[SHK] He will not know what all but he do know
[SHK] And as he errs doting on Hermia 's eyes
[SHK] So I admiring of his qualities
[SHK] Things base and vile folding no quantity
[SHK] Love can transpose to form and dignity
[SHK] Love looks not with the eyes but with the mind
[SHK] And therefore is wing 'd Cupid painted blind
[SHK] Nor hath Love 's mind of any judgement taste
[SHK] Wings and no eyes figure unheedy haste
[SHK] And therefore is Love said to be a child
[SHK] Because in choice he is so oft beguiled
[SHK] As waggish boys in game themselves forswear
[SHK] So the boy Love is perjured every where
[SHK] For ere Demetrius look 'd on Hermia 's eyne
[SHK] He hail 'd down oaths that he was only mine
[SHK] And when this hail some heat from Hermia felt
[SHK] So he dissolved and showers of oaths did melt
[SHK] I will go tell him of fair Hermia 's flight
[SHK] Then to the wood will he to-morrow night
[SHK] Pursue her and for this intelligence
[SHK] If I have thanks it is a dear expense
[SHK] But herein mean I to enrich my pain
[SHK] To have his sight thither and back again
[SHK] Is all our company here
[SHK] You were best to call them generally man by man
[SHK] according to the scrip
[SHK] Here is the scroll of every man 's name which is
[SHK] thought fit through all Athens to play in our
[SHK] interlude before the duke and the duchess on his
[SHK] wedding-day at night
[SHK] First good Peter Quince say what the play treats
[SHK] on then read the names of the actors and so grow
[SHK] to a point
[SHK] Marry our play is The most lamentable comedy and
[SHK] most cruel death of Pyramus and Thisby
[SHK] A very good piece of work I assure you and a
[SHK] merry Now good Peter Quince call forth your
[SHK] actors by the scroll Masters spread yourselves
[SHK] Answer as I call you Nick Bottom the weaver
[SHK] Ready Name what part I am for and proceed
[SHK] You Nick Bottom are set down for Pyramus
[SHK] What is Pyramus a lover or a tyrant
[SHK] A lover that kills himself most gallant for love
[SHK] That will ask some tears in the true performing of
[SHK] it if I do it let the audience look to their
[SHK] eyes I will move storms I will condole in some
[SHK] measure To the rest yet my chief humour is for a
[SHK] tyrant I could play Ercles rarely or a part to
[SHK] tear a cat in to make all split
[SHK] The raging rocks
[SHK] And shivering shocks
[SHK] Shall break the locks
[SHK] Of prison gates
[SHK] And Phibbus car
[SHK] Shall shine from far
[SHK] And make and mar
[SHK] The foolish Fates
[SHK] This was lofty Now name the rest of the players
[SHK] This is Ercles vein a tyrant 's vein a lover is
[SHK] more condoling
[SHK] Francis Flute the bellows-mender
[SHK] Here Peter Quince
[SHK] Flute you must take Thisby on you
[SHK] What is Thisby a wandering knight
[SHK] It is the lady that Pyramus must love
[SHK] Nay faith let me not play a woman I have a beard coming
[SHK] That 's all one you shall play it in a mask and
[SHK] you may speak as small as you will
[SHK] An I may hide my face let me play Thisby too I 'll
[SHK] speak in a monstrous little voice 'Thisne
[SHK] Thisne 'Ah Pyramus lover dear thy Thisby dear
[SHK] and lady dear
[SHK] No no you must play Pyramus and Flute you Thisby
[SHK] Well proceed
[SHK] Robin Starveling the tailor
[SHK] Here Peter Quince
[SHK] Robin Starveling you must play Thisby 's mother
[SHK] Tom Snout the tinker
[SHK] Here Peter Quince
[SHK] You Pyramus father myself Thisby 's father
[SHK] Snug the joiner you the lion 's part and I
[SHK] hope here is a play fitted
[SHK] Have you the lion 's part written pray you if it
[SHK] be give it me for I am slow of study
[SHK] You may do it extempore for it is nothing but roaring
[SHK] Let me play the lion too I will roar that I will
[SHK] do any man 's heart good to hear me I will roar
[SHK] that I will make the duke say 'Let him roar again
[SHK] let him roar again
[SHK] An you should do it too terribly you would fright
[SHK] the duchess and the ladies that they would shriek
[SHK] and that were enough to hang us all
[SHK] That would hang us every mother 's son
[SHK] I grant you friends if that you should fright the
[SHK] ladies out of their wits they would have no more
[SHK] discretion but to hang us but I will aggravate my
[SHK] voice so that I will roar you as gently as any
[SHK] sucking dove I will roar you an 'twere any
[SHK] nightingale
[SHK] You can play no part but Pyramus for Pyramus is a
[SHK] sweet-faced man a proper man as one shall see in a
[SHK] summer 's day a most lovely gentleman-like man
[SHK] therefore you must needs play Pyramus
[SHK] Well I will undertake it What beard were I best
[SHK] to play it in
[SHK] Why what you will
[SHK] I will discharge it in either your straw-colour
[SHK] beard your orange-tawny beard your purple-in-grain
[SHK] beard or your French-crown-colour beard your
[SHK] perfect yellow
[SHK] Some of your French crowns have no hair at all and
[SHK] then you will play bare-faced But masters here
[SHK] are your parts and I am to entreat you request
[SHK] you and desire you to con them by to-morrow night
[SHK] and meet me in the palace wood a mile without the
[SHK] town by moonlight there will we rehearse for if
[SHK] we meet in the city we shall be dogged with
[SHK] company and our devices known In the meantime I
[SHK] will draw a bill of properties such as our play
[SHK] wants I pray you fail me not
[SHK] We will meet and there we may rehearse most
[SHK] obscenely and courageously Take pains be perfect adieu
[SHK] At the duke 's oak we meet
[SHK] Enough hold or cut bow-strings
[SHK] How now spirit whither wander you
[SHK] Over hill over dale
[SHK] Thorough bush thorough brier
[SHK] Over park over pale
[SHK] Thorough flood thorough fire
[SHK] I do wander everywhere
[SHK] Swifter than the moon 's sphere
[SHK] And I serve the fairy queen
[SHK] To dew her orbs upon the green
[SHK] The cowslips tall her pensioners be
[SHK] In their gold coats spots you see
[SHK] Those be rubies fairy favours
[SHK] In those freckles live their savours
[SHK] I must go seek some dewdrops here
[SHK] And hang a pearl in every cowslip 's ear
[SHK] Farewell thou lob of spirits I 'll be gone
[SHK] Our queen and all our elves come here anon
[SHK] The king doth keep his revels here to-night
[SHK] Take heed the queen come not within his sight
[SHK] For Oberon is passing fell and wrath
[SHK] Because that she as her attendant hath
[SHK] A lovely boy stolen from an Indian king
[SHK] She never had so sweet a changeling
[SHK] And jealous Oberon would have the child
[SHK] Knight of his train to trace the forests wild
[SHK] But she perforce withholds the loved boy
[SHK] Crowns him with flowers and makes him all her joy
[SHK] And now they never meet in grove or green
[SHK] By fountain clear or spangled starlight sheen
[SHK] But they do square that all their elves for fear
[SHK] Creep into acorn-cups and hide them there
[SHK] Either I mistake your shape and making quite
[SHK] Or else you are that shrewd and knavish sprite
[SHK] Call 'd Robin Goodfellow are not you he
[SHK] That frights the maidens of the villagery
[SHK] Skim milk and sometimes labour in the quern
[SHK] And bootless make the breathless housewife churn
[SHK] And sometime make the drink to bear no barm
[SHK] Mislead night-wanderers laughing at their harm
[SHK] Those that Hobgoblin call you and sweet Puck
[SHK] You do their work and they shall have good luck
[SHK] Are not you he
[SHK] Thou speak'st aright
[SHK] I am that merry wanderer of the night
[SHK] I jest to Oberon and make him smile
[SHK] When I a fat and bean-fed horse beguile
[SHK] Neighing in likeness of a filly foal
[SHK] And sometime lurk I in a gossip 's bowl
[SHK] In very likeness of a roasted crab
[SHK] And when she drinks against her lips I bob
[SHK] And on her wither 'd dewlap pour the ale
[SHK] The wisest aunt telling the saddest tale
[SHK] Sometime for three-foot stool mistaketh me
[SHK] Then slip I from her bum down topples she
[SHK] And 'tailor cries and falls into a cough
[SHK] And then the whole quire hold their hips and laugh
[SHK] And waxen in their mirth and neeze and swear
[SHK] A merrier hour was never wasted there
[SHK] But room fairy here comes Oberon
[SHK] And here my mistress Would that he were gone
[SHK] Ill met by moonlight proud Titania
[SHK] What jealous Oberon Fairies skip hence
[SHK] I have forsworn his bed and company
[SHK] Tarry rash wanton am not I thy lord
[SHK] Then I must be thy lady but I know
[SHK] When thou hast stolen away from fairy land
[SHK] And in the shape of Corin sat all day
[SHK] Playing on pipes of corn and versing love
[SHK] To amorous Phillida Why art thou here
[SHK] Come from the farthest Steppe of India
[SHK] But that forsooth the bouncing Amazon
[SHK] Your buskin 'd mistress and your warrior love
[SHK] To Theseus must be wedded and you come
[SHK] To give their bed joy and prosperity
[SHK] How canst thou thus for shame Titania
[SHK] Glance at my credit with Hippolyta
[SHK] Knowing I know thy love to Theseus
[SHK] Didst thou not lead him through the glimmering night
[SHK] From Perigenia whom he ravished
[SHK] And make him with fair AEgle break his faith
[SHK] With Ariadne and Antiopa
[SHK] These are the forgeries of jealousy
[SHK] And never since the middle summer 's spring
[SHK] Met we on hill in dale forest or mead
[SHK] By paved fountain or by rushy brook
[SHK] Or in the beached margent of the sea
[SHK] To dance our ringlets to the whistling wind
[SHK] But with thy brawls thou hast disturb 'd our sport
[SHK] Therefore the winds piping to us in vain
[SHK] As in revenge have suck 'd up from the sea
[SHK] Contagious fogs which falling in the land
[SHK] Have every pelting river made so proud
[SHK] That they have overborne their continents
[SHK] The ox hath therefore stretch 'd his yoke in vain
[SHK] The ploughman lost his sweat and the green corn
[SHK] Hath rotted ere his youth attain 'd a beard
[SHK] The fold stands empty in the drowned field
[SHK] And crows are fatted with the murrion flock
[SHK] The nine men 's morris is fill 'd up with mud
[SHK] And the quaint mazes in the wanton green
[SHK] For lack of tread are undistinguishable
[SHK] The human mortals want their winter here
[SHK] No night is now with hymn or carol blest
[SHK] Therefore the moon the governess of floods
[SHK] Pale in her anger washes all the air
[SHK] That rheumatic diseases do abound
[SHK] And thorough this distemperature we see
[SHK] The seasons alter hoary-headed frosts
[SHK] Far in the fresh lap of the crimson rose
[SHK] And on old Hiems thin and icy crown
[SHK] An odorous chaplet of sweet summer buds
[SHK] Is as in mockery set the spring the summer
[SHK] The childing autumn angry winter change
[SHK] Their wonted liveries and the mazed world
[SHK] By their increase now knows not which is which
[SHK] And this same progeny of evils comes
[SHK] From our debate from our dissension
[SHK] We are their parents and original
[SHK] Do you amend it then it lies in you
[SHK] Why should Titania cross her Oberon
[SHK] I do but beg a little changeling boy
[SHK] To be my henchman
[SHK] Set your heart at rest
[SHK] The fairy land buys not the child of me
[SHK] His mother was a votaress of my order
[SHK] And in the spiced Indian air by night
[SHK] Full often hath she gossip 'd by my side
[SHK] And sat with me on Neptune 's yellow sands
[SHK] Marking the embarked traders on the flood
[SHK] When we have laugh 'd to see the sails conceive
[SHK] And grow big-bellied with the wanton wind
[SHK] Which she with pretty and with swimming gait
[SHK] Following -- her womb then rich with my young squire --
[SHK] Would imitate and sail upon the land
[SHK] To fetch me trifles and return again
[SHK] As from a voyage rich with merchandise
[SHK] But she being mortal of that boy did die
[SHK] And for her sake do I rear up her boy
[SHK] And for her sake I will not part with him
[SHK] How long within this wood intend you stay
[SHK] Perchance till after Theseus wedding-day
[SHK] If you will patiently dance in our round
[SHK] And see our moonlight revels go with us
[SHK] If not shun me and I will spare your haunts
[SHK] Give me that boy and I will go with thee
[SHK] Not for thy fairy kingdom Fairies away
[SHK] We shall chide downright if I longer stay
[SHK] Well go thy way thou shalt not from this grove
[SHK] Till I torment thee for this injury
[SHK] My gentle Puck come hither Thou rememberest
[SHK] Since once I sat upon a promontory
[SHK] And heard a mermaid on a dolphin 's back
[SHK] Uttering such dulcet and harmonious breath
[SHK] That the rude sea grew civil at her song
[SHK] And certain stars shot madly from their spheres
[SHK] To hear the sea-maid 's music
[SHK] I remember
[SHK] That very time I saw but thou couldst not
[SHK] Flying between the cold moon and the earth
[SHK] Cupid all arm 'd a certain aim he took
[SHK] At a fair vestal throned by the west
[SHK] And loosed his love-shaft smartly from his bow
[SHK] As it should pierce a hundred thousand hearts
[SHK] But I might see young Cupid 's fiery shaft
[SHK] Quench 'd in the chaste beams of the watery moon
[SHK] And the imperial votaress passed on
[SHK] In maiden meditation fancy-free
[SHK] Yet mark 'd I where the bolt of Cupid fell
[SHK] It fell upon a little western flower
[SHK] Before milk-white now purple with love 's wound
[SHK] And maidens call it love-in-idleness
[SHK] Fetch me that flower the herb I shew 'd thee once
[SHK] The juice of it on sleeping eye-lids laid
[SHK] Will make or man or woman madly dote
[SHK] Upon the next live creature that it sees
[SHK] Fetch me this herb and be thou here again
[SHK] Ere the leviathan can swim a league
[SHK] I 'll put a girdle round about the earth
[SHK] In forty minutes
[SHK] Having once this juice
[SHK] I 'll watch Titania when she is asleep
[SHK] And drop the liquor of it in her eyes
[SHK] The next thing then she waking looks upon
[SHK] Be it on lion bear or wolf or bull
[SHK] On meddling monkey or on busy ape
[SHK] She shall pursue it with the soul of love
[SHK] And ere I take this charm from off her sight
[SHK] As I can take it with another herb
[SHK] I 'll make her render up her page to me
[SHK] But who comes here I am invisible
[SHK] And I will overhear their conference
[SHK] I love thee not therefore pursue me not
[SHK] Where is Lysander and fair Hermia
[SHK] The one I 'll slay the other slayeth me
[SHK] Thou told'st me they were stolen unto this wood
[SHK] And here am I and wode within this wood
[SHK] Because I can not meet my Hermia
[SHK] Hence get thee gone and follow me no more
[SHK] You draw me you hard-hearted adamant
[SHK] But yet you draw not iron for my heart
[SHK] Is true as steel leave you your power to draw
[SHK] And I shall have no power to follow you
[SHK] Do I entice you do I speak you fair
[SHK] Or rather do I not in plainest truth
[SHK] Tell you I do not nor I can not love you
[SHK] And even for that do I love you the more
[SHK] I am your spaniel and Demetrius
[SHK] The more you beat me I will fawn on you
[SHK] Use me but as your spaniel spurn me strike me
[SHK] Neglect me lose me only give me leave
[SHK] Unworthy as I am to follow you
[SHK] What worser place can I beg in your love --
[SHK] And yet a place of high respect with me --
[SHK] Than to be used as you use your dog
[SHK] Tempt not too much the hatred of my spirit
[SHK] For I am sick when I do look on thee
[SHK] And I am sick when I look not on you
[SHK] You do impeach your modesty too much
[SHK] To leave the city and commit yourself
[SHK] Into the hands of one that loves you not
[SHK] To trust the opportunity of night
[SHK] And the ill counsel of a desert place
[SHK] With the rich worth of your virginity
[SHK] Your virtue is my privilege for that
[SHK] It is not night when I do see your face
[SHK] Therefore I think I am not in the night
[SHK] Nor doth this wood lack worlds of company
[SHK] For you in my respect are all the world
[SHK] Then how can it be said I am alone
[SHK] When all the world is here to look on me
[SHK] I 'll run from thee and hide me in the brakes
[SHK] And leave thee to the mercy of wild beasts
[SHK] The wildest hath not such a heart as you
[SHK] Run when you will the story shall be changed
[SHK] Apollo flies and Daphne holds the chase
[SHK] The dove pursues the griffin the mild hind
[SHK] Makes speed to catch the tiger bootless speed
[SHK] When cowardice pursues and valour flies
[SHK] I will not stay thy questions let me go
[SHK] Or if thou follow me do not believe
[SHK] But I shall do thee mischief in the wood
[SHK] Ay in the temple in the town the field
[SHK] You do me mischief Fie Demetrius
[SHK] Your wrongs do set a scandal on my sex
[SHK] We can not fight for love as men may do
[SHK] We should be wood and were not made to woo
[SHK] I 'll follow thee and make a heaven of hell
[SHK] To die upon the hand I love so well
[SHK] Fare thee well nymph ere he do leave this grove
[SHK] Thou shalt fly him and he shall seek thy love
[SHK] Hast thou the flower there Welcome wanderer
[SHK] Ay there it is
[SHK] I pray thee give it me
[SHK] I know a bank where the wild thyme blows
[SHK] Where oxlips and the nodding violet grows
[SHK] Quite over-canopied with luscious woodbine
[SHK] With sweet musk-roses and with eglantine
[SHK] There sleeps Titania sometime of the night
[SHK] Lull 'd in these flowers with dances and delight
[SHK] And there the snake throws her enamell 'd skin
[SHK] Weed wide enough to wrap a fairy in
[SHK] And with the juice of this I 'll streak her eyes
[SHK] And make her full of hateful fantasies
[SHK] Take thou some of it and seek through this grove
[SHK] A sweet Athenian lady is in love
[SHK] With a disdainful youth anoint his eyes
[SHK] But do it when the next thing he espies
[SHK] May be the lady thou shalt know the man
[SHK] By the Athenian garments he hath on
[SHK] Effect it with some care that he may prove
[SHK] More fond on her than she upon her love
[SHK] And look thou meet me ere the first cock crow
[SHK] Fear not my lord your servant shall do so
[SHK] Come now a roundel and a fairy song
[SHK] Then for the third part of a minute hence
[SHK] Some to kill cankers in the musk-rose buds
[SHK] Some war with rere-mice for their leathern wings
[SHK] To make my small elves coats and some keep back
[SHK] The clamorous owl that nightly hoots and wonders
[SHK] At our quaint spirits Sing me now asleep
[SHK] Then to your offices and let me rest
[SHK] You spotted snakes with double tongue
[SHK] Thorny hedgehogs be not seen
[SHK] Newts and blind-worms do no wrong
[SHK] Come not near our fairy queen
[SHK] Philomel with melody
[SHK] Sing in our sweet lullaby
[SHK] Lulla lulla lullaby lulla lulla lullaby
[SHK] Never harm
[SHK] Nor spell nor charm
[SHK] Come our lovely lady nigh
[SHK] So good night with lullaby
[SHK] Weaving spiders come not here
[SHK] Hence you long-legg 'd spinners hence
[SHK] Beetles black approach not near
[SHK] Worm nor snail do no offence
[SHK] Philomel with melody c
[SHK] Hence away now all is well
[SHK] One aloof stand sentinel
[SHK] What thou seest when thou dost wake
[SHK] Do it for thy true-love take
[SHK] Love and languish for his sake
[SHK] Be it ounce or cat or bear
[SHK] Pard or boar with bristled hair
[SHK] In thy eye that shall appear
[SHK] When thou wakest it is thy dear
[SHK] Wake when some vile thing is near
[SHK] Fair love you faint with wandering in the wood
[SHK] And to speak troth I have forgot our way
[SHK] We 'll rest us Hermia if you think it good
[SHK] And tarry for the comfort of the day
[SHK] Be it so Lysander find you out a bed
[SHK] For I upon this bank will rest my head
[SHK] One turf shall serve as pillow for us both
[SHK] One heart one bed two bosoms and one troth
[SHK] Nay good Lysander for my sake my dear
[SHK] Lie further off yet do not lie so near
[SHK] O take the sense sweet of my innocence
[SHK] Love takes the meaning in love 's conference
[SHK] I mean that my heart unto yours is knit
[SHK] So that but one heart we can make of it
[SHK] Two bosoms interchained with an oath
[SHK] So then two bosoms and a single troth
[SHK] Then by your side no bed-room me deny
[SHK] For lying so Hermia I do not lie
[SHK] Lysander riddles very prettily
[SHK] Now much beshrew my manners and my pride
[SHK] If Hermia meant to say Lysander lied
[SHK] But gentle friend for love and courtesy
[SHK] Lie further off in human modesty
[SHK] Such separation as may well be said
[SHK] Becomes a virtuous bachelor and a maid
[SHK] So far be distant and good night sweet friend
[SHK] Thy love ne'er alter till thy sweet life end
[SHK] Amen amen to that fair prayer say I
[SHK] And then end life when I end loyalty
[SHK] Here is my bed sleep give thee all his rest
[SHK] With half that wish the wisher 's eyes be press 'd
[SHK] Through the forest have I gone
[SHK] But Athenian found I none
[SHK] On whose eyes I might approve
[SHK] This flower 's force in stirring love
[SHK] Night and silence. -- Who is here
[SHK] Weeds of Athens he doth wear
[SHK] This is he my master said
[SHK] Despised the Athenian maid
[SHK] And here the maiden sleeping sound
[SHK] On the dank and dirty ground
[SHK] Pretty soul she durst not lie
[SHK] Near this lack-love this kill-courtesy
[SHK] Churl upon thy eyes I throw
[SHK] All the power this charm doth owe
[SHK] When thou wakest let love forbid
[SHK] Sleep his seat on thy eyelid
[SHK] So awake when I am gone
[SHK] For I must now to Oberon
[SHK] Stay though thou kill me sweet Demetrius
[SHK] I charge thee hence and do not haunt me thus
[SHK] O wilt thou darkling leave me do not so
[SHK] Stay on thy peril I alone will go
[SHK] O I am out of breath in this fond chase
[SHK] The more my prayer the lesser is my grace
[SHK] Happy is Hermia wheresoe'er she lies
[SHK] For she hath blessed and attractive eyes
[SHK] How came her eyes so bright Not with salt tears
[SHK] If so my eyes are oftener wash 'd than hers
[SHK] No no I am as ugly as a bear
[SHK] For beasts that meet me run away for fear
[SHK] Therefore no marvel though Demetrius
[SHK] Do as a monster fly my presence thus
[SHK] What wicked and dissembling glass of mine
[SHK] Made me compare with Hermia 's sphery eyne

[SHK] Lysander if you live good sir awake
[SHK] Transparent Helena Nature shows art
[SHK] That through thy bosom makes me see thy heart
[SHK] Where is Demetrius O how fit a word
[SHK] Is that vile name to perish on my sword
[SHK] Do not say so Lysander say not so
[SHK] What though he love your Hermia Lord what though
[SHK] Yet Hermia still loves you then be content
[SHK] Content with Hermia No I do repent
[SHK] The tedious minutes I with her have spent
[SHK] Not Hermia but Helena I love
[SHK] Who will not change a raven for a dove
[SHK] The will of man is by his reason sway 'd
[SHK] And reason says you are the worthier maid
[SHK] Things growing are not ripe until their season
[SHK] So I being young till now ripe not to reason
[SHK] And touching now the point of human skill
[SHK] Reason becomes the marshal to my will
[SHK] And leads me to your eyes where I o'erlook
[SHK] Love 's stories written in love 's richest book
[SHK] Wherefore was I to this keen mockery born
[SHK] When at your hands did I deserve this scorn
[SHK] Is't not enough is't not enough young man
[SHK] That I did never no nor never can

[SHK] In such disdainful manner me to woo

[SHK] I thought you lord of more true gentleness
[SHK] O that a lady of one man refused
[SHK] Should of another therefore be abused
[SHK] She sees not Hermia Hermia sleep thou there
[SHK] And never mayst thou come Lysander near
[SHK] For as a surfeit of the sweetest things
[SHK] The deepest loathing to the stomach brings
[SHK] Or as tie heresies that men do leave
[SHK] Are hated most of those they did deceive
[SHK] So thou my surfeit and my heresy
[SHK] Of all be hated but the most of me
[SHK] And all my powers address your love and might
[SHK] To honour Helen and to be her knight

[SHK] Peter Quince --

[SHK] draw a sword to kill himself which the ladies
[SHK] can not abide How answer you that
[SHK] By r lakin a parlous fear
[SHK] I believe we must leave the killing out when all is done

[SHK] Pyramus is not killed indeed and for the more

[SHK] Pyramus but Bottom the weaver this will put them
[SHK] out of fear

[SHK] most dreadful thing for there is not a more fearful
[SHK] wild-fowl than your lion living and we ought to
[SHK] look to 't

[SHK] his name and tell them plainly he is Snug the joiner

[SHK] The ousel cock so black of hue

[SHK] The throstle with his note so true

[SHK] The finch the sparrow and the lark

[SHK] Tie up my love 's tongue bring him silently
[SHK] I wonder if Titania be awaked
[SHK] Then what it was that next came in her eye
[SHK] Which she must dote on in extremity
[SHK] Here comes my messenger
[SHK] How now mad spirit
[SHK] What night-rule now about this haunted grove
[SHK] My mistress with a monster is in love
[SHK] Near to her close and consecrated bower
[SHK] While she was in her dull and sleeping hour
[SHK] A crew of patches rude mechanicals
[SHK] That work for bread upon Athenian stalls
[SHK] Were met together to rehearse a play
[SHK] Intended for great Theseus nuptial-day
[SHK] The shallowest thick-skin of that barren sort
[SHK] Who Pyramus presented in their sport
[SHK] Forsook his scene and enter 'd in a brake
[SHK] When I did him at this advantage take
[SHK] An ass 's nole I fixed on his head
[SHK] Anon his Thisbe must be answered
[SHK] And forth my mimic comes When they him spy
[SHK] As wild geese that the creeping fowler eye
[SHK] Or russet-pated choughs many in sort
[SHK] Rising and cawing at the gun 's report
[SHK] Sever themselves and madly sweep the sky
[SHK] So at his sight away his fellows fly
[SHK] And at our stamp here o'er and o'er one falls
[SHK] He murder cries and help from Athens calls
[SHK] Their sense thus weak lost with their fears
[SHK] thus strong
[SHK] Made senseless things begin to do them wrong
[SHK] For briers and thorns at their apparel snatch
[SHK] Some sleeves some hats from yielders all
[SHK] things catch
[SHK] I led them on in this distracted fear
[SHK] And left sweet Pyramus translated there
[SHK] When in that moment so it came to pass
[SHK] Titania waked and straightway loved an ass
[SHK] This falls out better than I could devise
[SHK] But hast thou yet latch 'd the Athenian 's eyes
[SHK] With the love-juice as I did bid thee do
[SHK] I took him sleeping -- that is finish 'd too --
[SHK] And the Athenian woman by his side
[SHK] That when he waked of force she must be eyed
[SHK] Stand close this is the same Athenian
[SHK] This is the woman but not this the man
[SHK] O why rebuke you him that loves you so
[SHK] Lay breath so bitter on your bitter foe
[SHK] Now I but chide but I should use thee worse
[SHK] For thou I fear hast given me cause to curse
[SHK] If thou hast slain Lysander in his sleep
[SHK] Being o'er shoes in blood plunge in the deep
[SHK] And kill me too
[SHK] The sun was not so true unto the day
[SHK] As he to me would he have stolen away
[SHK] From sleeping Hermia I 'll believe as soon
[SHK] This whole earth may be bored and that the moon
[SHK] May through the centre creep and so displease
[SHK] Her brother 's noontide with Antipodes
[SHK] It can not be but thou hast murder 'd him
[SHK] So should a murderer look so dead so grim
[SHK] So should the murder 'd look and so should I
[SHK] Pierced through the heart with your stern cruelty
[SHK] Yet you the murderer look as bright as clear
[SHK] As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere
[SHK] What 's this to my Lysander where is he
[SHK] Ah good Demetrius wilt thou give him me
[SHK] I had rather give his carcass to my hounds
[SHK] Out dog out cur thou drivest me past the bounds
[SHK] Of maiden 's patience Hast thou slain him then
[SHK] Henceforth be never number 'd among men
[SHK] O once tell true tell true even for my sake
[SHK] Durst thou have look 'd upon him being awake
[SHK] And hast thou kill 'd him sleeping O brave touch
[SHK] Could not a worm an adder do so much
[SHK] An adder did it for with doubler tongue
[SHK] Than thine thou serpent never adder stung
[SHK] You spend your passion on a misprised mood
[SHK] I am not guilty of Lysander 's blood
[SHK] Nor is he dead for aught that I can tell
[SHK] I pray thee tell me then that he is well
[SHK] An if I could what should I get therefore
[SHK] A privilege never to see me more
[SHK] And from thy hated presence part I so
[SHK] See me no more whether he be dead or no
[SHK] There is no following her in this fierce vein
[SHK] Here therefore for a while I will remain
[SHK] So sorrow 's heaviness doth heavier grow
[SHK] For debt that bankrupt sleep doth sorrow owe
[SHK] Which now in some slight measure it will pay
[SHK] If for his tender here I make some stay
[SHK] What hast thou done thou hast mistaken quite
[SHK] And laid the love-juice on some true-love 's sight
[SHK] Of thy misprision must perforce ensue
[SHK] Some true love turn 'd and not a false turn 'd true
[SHK] Then fate o'er-rules that one man holding troth
[SHK] A million fail confounding oath on oath
[SHK] About the wood go swifter than the wind
[SHK] And Helena of Athens look thou find
[SHK] All fancy-sick she is and pale of cheer
[SHK] With sighs of love that costs the fresh blood dear
[SHK] By some illusion see thou bring her here
[SHK] I 'll charm his eyes against she do appear
[SHK] I go I go look how I go
[SHK] Swifter than arrow from the Tartar 's bow
[SHK] Flower of this purple dye
[SHK] Hit with Cupid 's archery
[SHK] Sink in apple of his eye
[SHK] When his love he doth espy
[SHK] Let her shine as gloriously
[SHK] As the Venus of the sky
[SHK] When thou wakest if she be by
[SHK] Beg of her for remedy
[SHK] Captain of our fairy band
[SHK] Helena is here at hand
[SHK] And the youth mistook by me
[SHK] Pleading for a lover 's fee
[SHK] Shall we their fond pageant see
[SHK] Lord what fools these mortals be
[SHK] Stand aside the noise they make
[SHK] Will cause Demetrius to awake
[SHK] Then will two at once woo one
[SHK] That must needs be sport alone
[SHK] And those things do best please me
[SHK] That befal preposterously
[SHK] Why should you think that I should woo in scorn
[SHK] Scorn and derision never come in tears
[SHK] Look when I vow I weep and vows so born
[SHK] In their nativity all truth appears
[SHK] How can these things in me seem scorn to you
[SHK] Bearing the badge of faith to prove them true
[SHK] You do advance your cunning more and more
[SHK] When truth kills truth O devilish-holy fray
[SHK] These vows are Hermia 's will you give her o'er
[SHK] Weigh oath with oath and you will nothing weigh
[SHK] Your vows to her and me put in two scales
[SHK] Will even weigh and both as light as tales
[SHK] I had no judgment when to her I swore
[SHK] Nor none in my mind now you give her o'er
[SHK] Demetrius loves her and he loves not you
[SHK] To what my love shall I compare thine eyne
[SHK] Crystal is muddy O how ripe in show
[SHK] Thy lips those kissing cherries tempting grow
[SHK] That pure congealed white high Taurus snow
[SHK] Fann 'd with the eastern wind turns to a crow
[SHK] When thou hold'st up thy hand O let me kiss
[SHK] This princess of pure white this seal of bliss
[SHK] O spite O hell I see you all are bent
[SHK] To set against me for your merriment
[SHK] If you we re civil and knew courtesy
[SHK] You would not do me thus much injury
[SHK] Can you not hate me as I know you do
[SHK] But you must join in souls to mock me too
[SHK] If you were men as men you are in show
[SHK] You would not use a gentle lady so
[SHK] To vow and swear and superpraise my parts
[SHK] When I am sure you hate me with your hearts
[SHK] You both are rivals and love Hermia
[SHK] And now both rivals to mock Helena
[SHK] A trim exploit a manly enterprise
[SHK] To conjure tears up in a poor maid 's eyes
[SHK] With your derision none of noble sort
[SHK] Would so offend a virgin and extort
[SHK] A poor soul 's patience all to make you sport
[SHK] You are unkind Demetrius be not so
[SHK] For you love Hermia this you know I know
[SHK] And here with all good will with all my heart
[SHK] In Hermia 's love I yield you up my part
[SHK] And yours of Helena to me bequeath
[SHK] Whom I do love and will do till my death
[SHK] Never did mockers waste more idle breath
[SHK] Lysander keep thy Hermia I will none
[SHK] If e'er I loved her all that love is gone
[SHK] My heart to her but as guest-wise sojourn 'd
[SHK] And now to Helen is it home return 'd
[SHK] There to remain
[SHK] Helen it is not so
[SHK] Disparage not the faith thou dost not know
[SHK] Lest to thy peril thou aby it dear
[SHK] Look where thy love comes yonder is thy dear
[SHK] Dark night that from the eye his function takes
[SHK] The ear more quick of apprehension makes
[SHK] Wherein it doth impair the seeing sense
[SHK] It pays the hearing double recompense
[SHK] Thou art not by mine eye Lysander found
[SHK] Mine ear I thank it brought me to thy sound
[SHK] But why unkindly didst thou leave me so
[SHK] Why should he stay whom love doth press to go
[SHK] What love could press Lysander from my side
[SHK] Lysander 's love that would not let him bide
[SHK] Fair Helena who more engilds the night
[SHK] Than all you fiery oes and eyes of light
[SHK] Why seek'st thou me could not this make thee know
[SHK] The hate I bear thee made me leave thee so
[SHK] You speak not as you think it can not be
[SHK] Lo she is one of this confederacy
[SHK] Now I perceive they have conjoin 'd all three
[SHK] To fashion this false sport in spite of me
[SHK] Injurious Hermia most ungrateful maid
[SHK] Have you conspired have you with these contrived
[SHK] To bait me with this foul derision
[SHK] Is all the counsel that we two have shared
[SHK] The sisters vows the hours that we have spent
[SHK] When we have chid the hasty-footed time
[SHK] For parting us -- O is it all forgot
[SHK] All school-days friendship childhood innocence
[SHK] We Hermia like two artificial gods
[SHK] Have with our needles created both one flower
[SHK] Both on one sampler sitting on one cushion
[SHK] Both warbling of one song both in one key
[SHK] As if our hands our sides voices and minds
[SHK] Had been incorporate So we grow together
[SHK] Like to a double cherry seeming parted
[SHK] But yet an union in partition
[SHK] Two lovely berries moulded on one stem
[SHK] So with two seeming bodies but one heart
[SHK] Two of the first like coats in heraldry
[SHK] Due but to one and crowned with one crest
[SHK] And will you rent our ancient love asunder
[SHK] To join with men in scorning your poor friend
[SHK] It is not friendly 't is not maidenly
[SHK] Our sex as well as I may chide you for it
[SHK] Though I alone do feel the injury
[SHK] I am amazed at your passionate words
[SHK] I scorn you not it seems that you scorn me
[SHK] Have you not set Lysander as in scorn
[SHK] To follow me and praise my eyes and face
[SHK] And made your other love Demetrius
[SHK] Who even but now did spurn me with his foot
[SHK] To call me goddess nymph divine and rare
[SHK] Precious celestial Wherefore speaks he this
[SHK] To her he hates and wherefore doth Lysander
[SHK] Deny your love so rich within his soul
[SHK] And tender me forsooth affection
[SHK] But by your setting on by your consent
[SHK] What thought I be not so in grace as you
[SHK] So hung upon with love so fortunate
[SHK] But miserable most to love unloved
[SHK] This you should pity rather than despise
[SHK] I understand not what you mean by this
[SHK] Ay do persever counterfeit sad looks
[SHK] Make mouths upon me when I turn my back
[SHK] Wink each at other hold the sweet jest up
[SHK] This sport well carried shall be chronicled
[SHK] If you have any pity grace or manners
[SHK] You would not make me such an argument
[SHK] But fare ye well 't is partly my own fault
[SHK] Which death or absence soon shall remedy
[SHK] Stay gentle Helena hear my excuse
[SHK] My love my life my soul fair Helena
[SHK] O excellent
[SHK] Sweet do not scorn her so
[SHK] If she can not entreat I can compel
[SHK] Thou canst compel no more than she entreat
[SHK] Thy threats have no more strength than her weak prayers
[SHK] Helen I love thee by my life I do
[SHK] I swear by that which I will lose for thee
[SHK] To prove him false that says I love thee not
[SHK] I say I love thee more than he can do
[SHK] If thou say so withdraw and prove it too
[SHK] Quick come
[SHK] Lysander whereto tends all this
[SHK] Away you Ethiope
[SHK] No no he 'll
[SHK] Seem to break loose take on as you would follow

[SHK] Hang off thou cat thou burr vile thing let loose

[SHK] Sweet love --
[SHK] Thy love out tawny Tartar out
[SHK] Out loathed medicine hated potion hence
[SHK] Do you not jest
[SHK] Yes sooth and so do you
[SHK] Demetrius I will keep my word with thee
[SHK] I would I had your bond for I perceive
[SHK] A weak bond holds you I 'll not trust your word
[SHK] What should I hurt her strike her kill her dead

[SHK] What can you do me greater harm than hate
[SHK] Hate me wherefore O me what news my love

[SHK] me

[SHK] And never did desire to see thee more

[SHK] That I do hate thee and love Helena

[SHK] Fine i'faith
[SHK] Have you no modesty no maiden shame

[SHK] Impatient answers from my gentle tongue
[SHK] Fie fie you counterfeit you puppet you
[SHK] Puppet why so ay that way goes the game
[SHK] Now I perceive that she hath made compare
[SHK] Between our statures she hath urged her height
[SHK] And with her personage her tall personage
[SHK] Her height forsooth she hath prevail 'd with him
[SHK] And are you grown so high in his esteem
[SHK] Because I am so dwarfish and so low
[SHK] How low am I thou painted maypole speak
[SHK] How low am I I am not yet so low
[SHK] But that my nails can reach unto thine eyes
[SHK] I pray you though you mock me gentlemen
[SHK] Let her not hurt me I was never curst
[SHK] I have no gift at all in shrewishness
[SHK] I am a right maid for my cowardice
[SHK] Let her not strike me You perhaps may think
[SHK] Because she is something lower than myself
[SHK] That I can match her
[SHK] Lower hark again
[SHK] Good Hermia do not be so bitter with me
[SHK] I evermore did love you Hermia
[SHK] Did ever keep your counsels never wrong 'd you
[SHK] Save that in love unto Demetrius
[SHK] I told him of your stealth unto this wood
[SHK] He follow 'd you for love I follow 'd him
[SHK] But he hath chid me hence and threaten 'd me
[SHK] To strike me spurn me nay to kill me too
[SHK] And now so you will let me quiet go
[SHK] To Athens will I bear my folly back
[SHK] And follow you no further let me go
[SHK] You see how simple and how fond I am

[SHK] A foolish heart that I leave here behind

[SHK] With Demetrius
[SHK] Be not afraid she shall not harm thee Helena

[SHK] In her behalf that scorns your services

[SHK] I will not trust you I
[SHK] Nor longer stay in your curst company

[SHK] My legs are longer though to run away
[SHK] I am amazed and know not what to say

[SHK] Believe me king of shadows I mistook

[SHK] By the Athenian garment be had on

[SHK] That I have 'nointed an Athenian 's eyes
[SHK] And so far am I glad it so did sort
[SHK] As this their jangling I esteem a sport
[SHK] Thou see'st these lovers seek a place to fight
[SHK] Hie therefore Robin overcast the night
[SHK] The starry welkin cover thou anon
[SHK] With drooping fog as black as Acheron
[SHK] And lead these testy rivals so astray
[SHK] As one come not within another 's way
[SHK] Like to Lysander sometime frame thy tongue
[SHK] Then stir Demetrius up with bitter wrong
[SHK] And sometime rail thou like Demetrius
[SHK] And from each other look thou lead them thus
[SHK] Till o'er their brows death-counterfeiting sleep
[SHK] With leaden legs and batty wings doth creep
[SHK] Then crush this herb into Lysander 's eye
[SHK] Whose liquor hath this virtuous property
[SHK] To take from thence all error with his might
[SHK] And make his eyeballs roll with wonted sight
[SHK] When they next wake all this derision
[SHK] Shall seem a dream and fruitless vision
[SHK] And back to Athens shall the lovers wend
[SHK] With league whose date till death shall never end
[SHK] Whiles I in this affair do thee employ
[SHK] I 'll to my queen and beg her Indian boy
[SHK] And then I will her charmed eye release
[SHK] From monster 's view and all things shall be peace
[SHK] My fairy lord this must be done with haste
[SHK] For night 's swift dragons cut the clouds full fast
[SHK] And yonder shines Aurora 's harbinger
[SHK] At whose approach ghosts wandering here and there
[SHK] Troop home to churchyards damned spirits all
[SHK] That in crossways and floods have burial
[SHK] Already to their wormy beds are gone
[SHK] For fear lest day should look their shames upon
[SHK] They willfully themselves exile from light
[SHK] And must for aye consort with black-brow 'd night
[SHK] But we are spirits of another sort
[SHK] I with the morning 's love have oft made sport
[SHK] And like a forester the groves may tread
[SHK] Even till the eastern gate all fiery-red
[SHK] Opening on Neptune with fair blessed beams
[SHK] Turns into yellow gold his salt green streams
[SHK] But notwithstanding haste make no delay
[SHK] We may effect this business yet ere day
[SHK] Up and down up and down
[SHK] I will lead them up and down
[SHK] I am fear 'd in field and town
[SHK] Goblin lead them up and down

[SHK] dry oats Methinks I have a great desire to a bottle

[SHK] I had rather have a handful or two of dried peas
[SHK] But I pray you let none of your people stir me I
[SHK] have an exposition of sleep come upon me
[SHK] Sleep thou and I will wind thee in my arms
[SHK] Fairies begone and be all ways away
[SHK] So doth the woodbine the sweet honeysuckle
[SHK] Gently entwist the female ivy so
[SHK] Enrings the barky fingers of the elm
[SHK] O how I love thee how I dote on thee
[SHK] See'st thou this sweet sight
[SHK] Her dotage now I do begin to pity
[SHK] For meeting her of late behind the wood
[SHK] Seeking sweet favours from this hateful fool
[SHK] I did upbraid her and fall out with her
[SHK] For she his hairy temples then had rounded
[SHK] With a coronet of fresh and fragrant flowers
[SHK] And that same dew which sometime on the buds
[SHK] Was wont to swell like round and orient pearls
[SHK] Stood now within the pretty flowerets eyes
[SHK] Like tears that did their own disgrace bewail
[SHK] When I had at my pleasure taunted her
[SHK] And she in mild terms begg 'd my patience
[SHK] I then did ask of her her changeling child
[SHK] Which straight she gave me and her fairy sent
[SHK] To bear him to my bower in fairy land
[SHK] And now I have the boy I will undo
[SHK] This hateful imperfection of her eyes
[SHK] And gentle Puck take this transformed scalp
[SHK] From off the head of this Athenian swain
[SHK] That he awaking when the other do
[SHK] May all to Athens back again repair
[SHK] And think no more of this night 's accidents
[SHK] But as the fierce vexation of a dream
[SHK] But first I will release the fairy queen
[SHK] Be as thou wast wont to be

[SHK] Dian 's bud o'er Cupid 's flower
[SHK] Hath such force and blessed power

[SHK] own fool 's eyes peep
