[SHK] Do lace the severing clouds in yonder east
[SHK] Night 's candles are burnt out and jocund day
[SHK] Stands tiptoe on the misty mountain tops
[SHK] I must be gone and live or stay and die
[SHK] Yon light is not day-light I know it I
[SHK] It is some meteor that the sun exhales
[SHK] To be to thee this night a torch-bearer
[SHK] And light thee on thy way to Mantua
[SHK] Therefore stay yet thou need'st not to be gone
[SHK] Let me be ta'en let me be put to death
[SHK] I am content so thou wilt have it so
[SHK] I 'll say yon grey is not the morning 's eye
[SHK] 'T is but the pale reflex of Cynthia 's brow
[SHK] Nor that is not the lark whose notes do beat
[SHK] The vaulty heaven so high above our heads
[SHK] I have more care to stay than will to go
[SHK] Come death and welcome Juliet wills it so
[SHK] How is't my soul let 's talk it is not day
[SHK] It is it is hie hence be gone away
[SHK] It is the lark that sings so out of tune
[SHK] Straining harsh discords and unpleasing sharps
[SHK] Some say the lark makes sweet division
[SHK] This doth not so for she divideth us
[SHK] Some say the lark and loathed toad change eyes
[SHK] O now I would they had changed voices too
[SHK] Since arm from arm that voice doth us affray
[SHK] Hunting thee hence with hunt's-up to the day
[SHK] O now be gone more light and light it grows
[SHK] More light and light more dark and dark our woes
[SHK] Madam
[SHK] Nurse
[SHK] Your lady mother is coming to your chamber
[SHK] The day is broke be wary look about
[SHK] Then window let day in and let life out
[SHK] Farewell farewell one kiss and I 'll descend
[SHK] Art thou gone so love lord ay husband friend
[SHK] I must hear from thee every day in the hour
[SHK] For in a minute there are many days
[SHK] O by this count I shall be much in years
[SHK] Ere I again behold my Romeo
[SHK] Farewell
[SHK] I will omit no opportunity
[SHK] That may convey my greetings love to thee
[SHK] O think'st thou we shall ever meet again
[SHK] I doubt it not and all these woes shall serve
[SHK] For sweet discourses in our time to come
[SHK] O God I have an ill-divining soul
[SHK] Methinks I see thee now thou art below
[SHK] As one dead in the bottom of a tomb
[SHK] Either my eyesight fails or thou look'st pale
[SHK] And trust me love in my eye so do you
[SHK] Dry sorrow drinks our blood Adieu adieu
[SHK] O fortune fortune all men call thee fickle
[SHK] If thou art fickle what dost thou with him
[SHK] That is renown 'd for faith Be fickle fortune
[SHK] For then I hope thou wilt not keep him long
[SHK] But send him back
[SHK] Who is't that calls is it my lady mother
[SHK] Is she not down so late or up so early
[SHK] What unaccustom 'd cause procures her hither
[SHK] Why how now Juliet
[SHK] Madam I am not well
[SHK] Evermore weeping for your cousin 's death
[SHK] What wilt thou wash him from his grave with tears
[SHK] An if thou couldst thou couldst not make him live
[SHK] Therefore have done some grief shows much of love
[SHK] But much of grief shows still some want of wit
[SHK] Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss
[SHK] So shall you feel the loss but not the friend
[SHK] Which you weep for
[SHK] Feeling so the loss
[SHK] Can not choose but ever weep the friend
[SHK] Well girl thou weep'st not so much for his death
[SHK] As that the villain lives which slaughter 'd him
[SHK] What villain madam
[SHK] That same villain Romeo
[SHK] God Pardon him I do with all my heart
[SHK] And yet no man like he doth grieve my heart
[SHK] That is because the traitor murderer lives
[SHK] Ay madam from the reach of these my hands
[SHK] Would none but I might venge my cousin 's death
[SHK] We will have vengeance for it fear thou not
[SHK] Then weep no more I 'll send to one in Mantua
[SHK] Where that same banish 'd runagate doth live
[SHK] Shall give him such an unaccustom 'd dram
[SHK] That he shall soon keep Tybalt company
[SHK] And then I hope thou wilt be satisfied
[SHK] Indeed I never shall be satisfied
[SHK] With Romeo till I behold him -- dead --
[SHK] Is my poor heart for a kinsman vex 'd
[SHK] Madam if you could find out but a man
[SHK] To bear a poison I would temper it
[SHK] That Romeo should upon receipt thereof
[SHK] Soon sleep in quiet O how my heart abhors
[SHK] To hear him named and can not come to him
[SHK] To wreak the love I bore my cousin
[SHK] Upon his body that slaughter 'd him
[SHK] Find thou the means and I 'll find such a man
[SHK] But now I 'll tell thee joyful tidings girl
[SHK] And joy comes well in such a needy time
[SHK] What are they I beseech your ladyship
[SHK] Well well thou hast a careful father child
[SHK] One who to put thee from thy heaviness
[SHK] Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy
[SHK] That thou expect'st not nor I look 'd not for
[SHK] Madam in happy time what day is that
[SHK] Marry my child early next Thursday morn
[SHK] The gallant young and noble gentleman
[SHK] The County Paris at Saint Peter 's Church
[SHK] Shall happily make thee there a joyful bride
[SHK] Now by Saint Peter 's Church and Peter too
[SHK] He shall not make me there a joyful bride
[SHK] I wonder at this haste that I must wed
[SHK] Ere he that should be husband comes to woo
[SHK] I pray you tell my lord and father madam
[SHK] I will not marry yet and when I do I swear
[SHK] It shall be Romeo whom you know I hate
[SHK] Rather than Paris These are news indeed
[SHK] Here comes your father tell him so yourself
[SHK] And see how he will take it at your hands
[SHK] When the sun sets the air doth drizzle dew
[SHK] But for the sunset of my brother 's son
[SHK] It rains downright
[SHK] How now a conduit girl what still in tears
[SHK] Evermore showering In one little body
[SHK] Thou counterfeit'st a bark a sea a wind
[SHK] For still thy eyes which I may call the sea
[SHK] Do ebb and flow with tears the bark thy body is
[SHK] Sailing in this salt flood the winds thy sighs
[SHK] Who raging with thy tears and they with them
[SHK] Without a sudden calm will overset
[SHK] Thy tempest-tossed body How now wife
[SHK] Have you deliver 'd to her our decree
[SHK] Ay sir but she will none she gives you thanks
[SHK] I would the fool were married to her grave
[SHK] Soft take me with you take me with you wife
[SHK] How will she none doth she not give us thanks
[SHK] Is she not proud doth she not count her blest
[SHK] Unworthy as she is that we have wrought
[SHK] So worthy a gentleman to be her bridegroom
[SHK] Not proud you have but thankful that you have
[SHK] Proud can I never be of what I hate
[SHK] But thankful even for hate that is meant love
[SHK] How now how now chop-logic What is this
[SHK] 'Proud and I thank you and I thank you not
[SHK] And yet 'not proud mistress minion you
[SHK] Thank me no thankings nor proud me no prouds
[SHK] But fettle your fine joints 'gainst Thursday next
[SHK] To go with Paris to Saint Peter 's Church
[SHK] Or I will drag thee on a hurdle thither
[SHK] Out you green-sickness carrion out you baggage
[SHK] You tallow-face
[SHK] Fie fie what are you mad
[SHK] Good father I beseech you on my knees
[SHK] Hear me with patience but to speak a word
[SHK] Hang thee young baggage disobedient wretch
[SHK] I tell thee what get thee to church o Thursday
[SHK] Or never after look me in the face
[SHK] Speak not reply not do not answer me
[SHK] My fingers itch Wife we scarce thought us blest
[SHK] That God had lent us but this only child
[SHK] But now I see this one is one too much
[SHK] And that we have a curse in having her
[SHK] Out on her hilding
[SHK] God in heaven bless her
[SHK] You are to blame my lord to rate her so
[SHK] And why my lady wisdom hold your tongue
[SHK] Good prudence smatter with your gossips go
[SHK] I speak no treason
[SHK] O God ye god-den
[SHK] May not one speak
[SHK] Peace you mumbling fool
[SHK] Utter your gravity o'er a gossip 's bowl
[SHK] For here we need it not
[SHK] You are too hot
[SHK] God 's bread it makes me mad
[SHK] Day night hour tide time work play
[SHK] Alone in company still my care hath been
[SHK] To have her match 'd and having now provided
[SHK] A gentleman of noble parentage
[SHK] Of fair demesnes youthful and nobly train 'd
[SHK] Stuff 'd as they say with honourable parts
[SHK] Proportion 'd as one 's thought would wish a man
[SHK] And then to have a wretched puling fool
[SHK] A whining mammet in her fortune 's tender
[SHK] To answer I 'll not wed I can not love
[SHK] I am too young I pray you pardon me
[SHK] But as you will not wed I 'll pardon you
[SHK] Graze where you will you shall not house with me
[SHK] Look to't think o n't I do not use to jest
[SHK] Thursday is near lay hand on heart advise
[SHK] An you be mine I 'll give you to my friend
[SHK] And you be not hang beg starve die in
[SHK] the streets
[SHK] For by my soul I 'll ne'er acknowledge thee
[SHK] Nor what is mine shall never do thee good
[SHK] Trust to't bethink you I 'll not be forsworn
[SHK] Is there no pity sitting in the clouds
[SHK] That sees into the bottom of my grief
[SHK] O sweet my mother cast me not away
[SHK] Delay this marriage for a month a week
[SHK] Or if you do not make the bridal bed
[SHK] In that dim monument where Tybalt lies
[SHK] Talk not to me for I 'll not speak a word
[SHK] Do as thou wilt for I have done with thee
[SHK] O God -- O nurse how shall this be prevented
[SHK] My husband is on earth my faith in heaven
[SHK] How shall that faith return again to earth
[SHK] Unless that husband send it me from heaven
[SHK] By leaving earth comfort me counsel me
[SHK] Alack alack that heaven should practise stratagems
[SHK] Upon so soft a subject as myself
[SHK] What say'st thou hast thou not a word of joy
[SHK] Some comfort nurse
[SHK] Faith here it is
[SHK] Romeo is banish 'd and all the world to nothing
[SHK] That he dares ne'er come back to challenge you
[SHK] Or if he do it needs must be by stealth
[SHK] Then since the case so stands as now it doth
[SHK] I think it best you married with the county
[SHK] O he 's a lovely gentleman
[SHK] Romeo 's a dishclout to him an eagle madam
[SHK] Hath not so green so quick so fair an eye
[SHK] As Paris hath Beshrew my very heart
[SHK] I think you are happy in this second match
[SHK] For it excels your first or if it did not
[SHK] Your first is dead or 'twere as good he were
[SHK] As living here and you no use of him
[SHK] Speakest thou from thy heart
[SHK] And from my soul too
[SHK] Or else beshrew them both
[SHK] Amen
[SHK] What
[SHK] Well thou hast comforted me marvellous much
[SHK] Go in and tell my lady I am gone
[SHK] Having displeased my father to Laurence cell
[SHK] To make confession and to be absolved
[SHK] Marry I will and this is wisely done
[SHK] Ancient damnation O most wicked fiend
[SHK] Is it more sin to wish me thus forsworn
[SHK] Or to dispraise my lord with that same tongue
[SHK] Which she hath praised him with above compare
[SHK] So many thousand times Go counsellor
[SHK] Thou and my bosom henceforth shall be twain
[SHK] I 'll to the friar to know his remedy
[SHK] If all else fail myself have power to die
[SHK] On Thursday sir the time is very short
[SHK] My father Capulet will have it so
[SHK] And I am nothing slow to slack his haste
[SHK] You say you do not know the lady 's mind
[SHK] Uneven is the course I like it not
[SHK] Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt 's death
[SHK] And therefore have I little talk 'd of love
[SHK] For Venus smiles not in a house of tears
[SHK] Now sir her father counts it dangerous
[SHK] That she doth give her sorrow so much sway
[SHK] And in his wisdom hastes our marriage
[SHK] To stop the inundation of her tears
[SHK] Which too much minded by herself alone
[SHK] May be put from her by society
[SHK] Now do you know the reason of this haste
[SHK] Look sir here comes the lady towards my cell
[SHK] Happily met my lady and my wife
[SHK] That may be sir when I may be a wife
[SHK] That may be must be love on Thursday next
[SHK] What must be shall be
[SHK] That 's a certain text
[SHK] Come you to make confession to this father
[SHK] To answer that I should confess to you
[SHK] Do not deny to him that you love me
[SHK] I will confess to you that I love him
[SHK] So will ye I am sure that you love me
[SHK] If I do so it will be of more price
[SHK] Being spoke behind your back than to your face
[SHK] Poor soul thy face is much abused with tears
[SHK] The tears have got small victory by that
[SHK] For it was bad enough before their spite
[SHK] Thou wrong'st it more than tears with that report
[SHK] That is no slander sir which is a truth
[SHK] And what I spake I spake it to my face
[SHK] Thy face is mine and thou hast slander 'd it
[SHK] It may be so for it is not mine own
[SHK] Are you at leisure holy father now
[SHK] Or shall I come to you at evening mass
[SHK] My leisure serves me pensive daughter now
[SHK] My lord we must entreat the time alone
[SHK] God shield I should disturb devotion
[SHK] Juliet on Thursday early will I rouse ye
[SHK] Till then adieu and keep this holy kiss
[SHK] O shut the door and when thou hast done so
[SHK] Come weep with me past hope past cure past help
[SHK] Ah Juliet I already know thy grief
[SHK] It strains me past the compass of my wits
[SHK] I hear thou must and nothing may prorogue it
[SHK] On Thursday next be married to this county
[SHK] Tell me not friar that thou hear'st of this
[SHK] Unless thou tell me how I may prevent it
[SHK] If in thy wisdom thou canst give no help
[SHK] Do thou but call my resolution wise
[SHK] And with this knife I 'll help it presently
[SHK] God join 'd my heart and Romeo 's thou our hands
[SHK] And ere this hand by thee to Romeo seal 'd
[SHK] Shall be the label to another deed
[SHK] Or my true heart with treacherous revolt
[SHK] Turn to another this shall slay them both
[SHK] Therefore out of thy long-experienced time
[SHK] Give me some present counsel or behold
[SHK] 'Twixt my extremes and me this bloody knife
[SHK] Shall play the umpire arbitrating that
[SHK] Which the commission of thy years and art
[SHK] Could to no issue of true honour bring
[SHK] Be not so long to speak I long to die
[SHK] If what thou speak'st speak not of remedy
[SHK] Hold daughter I do spy a kind of hope
[SHK] Which craves as desperate an execution
[SHK] As that is desperate which we would prevent
[SHK] If rather than to marry County Paris
[SHK] Thou hast the strength of will to slay thyself
[SHK] Then is it likely thou wilt undertake
[SHK] A thing like death to chide away this shame
[SHK] That copest with death himself to scape from it
[SHK] And if thou darest I 'll give thee remedy
[SHK] O bid me leap rather than marry Paris
[SHK] From off the battlements of yonder tower
[SHK] Or walk in thievish ways or bid me lurk
[SHK] Where serpents are chain me with roaring bears
[SHK] Or shut me nightly in a charnel-house
[SHK] O'er-cover 'd quite with dead men 's rattling bones
[SHK] With reeky shanks and yellow chapless skulls
[SHK] Or bid me go into a new-made grave
[SHK] And hide me with a dead man in his shroud
[SHK] Things that to hear them told have made me tremble
[SHK] And I will do it without fear or doubt
[SHK] To live an unstain 'd wife to my sweet love
[SHK] Hold then go home be merry give consent
[SHK] To marry Paris Wednesday is to-morrow
[SHK] To-morrow night look that thou lie alone
[SHK] Let not thy nurse lie with thee in thy chamber
[SHK] Take thou this vial being then in bed
[SHK] And this distilled liquor drink thou off
[SHK] When presently through all thy veins shall run
[SHK] A cold and drowsy humour for no pulse
[SHK] Shall keep his native progress but surcease
[SHK] No warmth no breath shall testify thou livest
[SHK] The roses in thy lips and cheeks shall fade
[SHK] To paly ashes thy eyes windows fall
[SHK] Like death when he shuts up the day of life
[SHK] Each part deprived of supple government
[SHK] Shall stiff and stark and cold appear like death
[SHK] And in this borrow 'd likeness of shrunk death
[SHK] Thou shalt continue two and forty hours
[SHK] And then awake as from a pleasant sleep
[SHK] Now when the bridegroom in the morning comes
[SHK] To rouse thee from thy bed there art thou dead
[SHK] Then as the manner of our country is
[SHK] In thy best robes uncover 'd on the bier
[SHK] Thou shalt be borne to that same ancient vault
[SHK] Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie
[SHK] In the mean time against thou shalt awake
[SHK] Shall Romeo by my letters know our drift
[SHK] And hither shall he come and he and I
[SHK] Will watch thy waking and that very night
[SHK] Shall Romeo bear thee hence to Mantua
[SHK] And this shall free thee from this present shame
[SHK] If no inconstant toy nor womanish fear
[SHK] Abate thy valour in the acting it
[SHK] Give me give me O tell not me of fear
[SHK] Hold get you gone be strong and prosperous
[SHK] In this resolve I 'll send a friar with speed
[SHK] To Mantua with my letters to thy lord
[SHK] Love give me strength and strength shall help afford
[SHK] Farewell dear father
[SHK] So many guests invite as here are writ

[SHK] You shall have none ill sir for I 'll try if they

[SHK] own fingers therefore he that can not lick his
[SHK] fingers goes not with me

[SHK] We shall be much unfurnished for this time

[SHK] Ay forsooth

[SHK] Shall I be married then to-morrow morning

[SHK] What if it be a poison which the friar
[SHK] Subtly hath minister 'd to have me dead
[SHK] Lest in this marriage he should be dishonour 'd
[SHK] Because he married me before to Romeo
[SHK] I fear it is and yet methinks it should not
[SHK] For he hath still been tried a holy man
[SHK] How if when I am laid into the tomb
[SHK] I wake before the time that Romeo
[SHK] Come to redeem me there 's a fearful point
[SHK] Shall I not then be stifled in the vault
[SHK] To whose foul mouth no healthsome air breathes in
[SHK] And there die strangled ere my Romeo comes
[SHK] Or if I live is it not very like
[SHK] The horrible conceit of death and night
[SHK] Together with the terror of the place --
[SHK] As in a vault an ancient receptacle
[SHK] Where for these many hundred years the bones
[SHK] Of all my buried ancestors are packed
[SHK] Where bloody Tybalt yet but green in earth
[SHK] Lies festering in his shroud where as they say
[SHK] At some hours in the night spirits resort --
[SHK] Alack alack is it not like that I
[SHK] So early waking what with loathsome smells
[SHK] And shrieks like mandrakes torn out of the earth
[SHK] That living mortals hearing them run mad --
[SHK] O if I wake shall I not be distraught
[SHK] Environed with all these hideous fears
[SHK] And madly play with my forefather 's joints
[SHK] And pluck the mangled Tybalt from his shroud
[SHK] And in this rage with some great kinsman 's bone
[SHK] As with a club dash out my desperate brains
[SHK] O look methinks I see my cousin 's ghost
[SHK] Seeking out Romeo that did spit his body
[SHK] Upon a rapier 's point stay Tybalt stay

[SHK] O lamentable day
[SHK] O woful time
[SHK] Death that hath ta'en her hence to make me wail
[SHK] Ties up my tongue and will not let me speak
[SHK] Come is the bride ready to go to church
[SHK] Ready to go but never to return
[SHK] O son the night before thy wedding-day
[SHK] Hath Death lain with thy wife There she lies
[SHK] Flower as she was deflowered by him
[SHK] Death is my son-in-law Death is my heir
[SHK] My daughter he hath wedded I will die
[SHK] And leave him all life living all is Death 's
[SHK] Have I thought long to see this morning 's face
[SHK] And doth it give me such a sight as this
[SHK] Accursed unhappy wretched hateful day
[SHK] Most miserable hour that e'er time saw
[SHK] In lasting labour of his pilgrimage
[SHK] But one poor one one poor and loving child
[SHK] But one thing to rejoice and solace in
[SHK] And cruel death hath catch 'd it from my sight
[SHK] O woe O woful woful woful day
[SHK] Most lamentable day most woful day
[SHK] That ever ever I did yet behold
[SHK] O day O day O day O hateful day
[SHK] Never was seen so black a day as this
[SHK] O woful day O woful day
[SHK] Beguiled divorced wronged spited slain
[SHK] Most detestable death by thee beguil 'd
[SHK] By cruel cruel thee quite overthrown
[SHK] O love O life not life but love in death
[SHK] Despised distressed hated martyr 'd kill 'd
[SHK] Uncomfortable time why camest thou now
[SHK] To murder murder our solemnity
[SHK] O child O child my soul and not my child
[SHK] Dead art thou Alack my child is dead
[SHK] And with my child my joys are buried
[SHK] Peace ho for shame confusion 's cure lives not
[SHK] In these confusions Heaven and yourself
[SHK] Had part in this fair maid now heaven hath all
[SHK] And all the better is it for the maid
[SHK] Your part in her you could not keep from death
[SHK] But heaven keeps his part in eternal life
[SHK] The most you sought was her promotion
[SHK] For 't was your heaven she should be advanced
[SHK] And weep ye now seeing she is advanced
[SHK] Above the clouds as high as heaven itself
[SHK] O in this love you love your child so ill
[SHK] That you run mad seeing that she is well
[SHK] She 's not well married that lives married long
[SHK] But she 's best married that dies married young
[SHK] Dry up your tears and stick your rosemary
[SHK] On this fair corse and as the custom is
[SHK] In all her best array bear her to church
[SHK] For though fond nature bids us an lament
[SHK] Yet nature 's tears are reason 's merriment
[SHK] All things that we ordained festival
[SHK] Turn from their office to black funeral
[SHK] Our instruments to melancholy bells
[SHK] Our wedding cheer to a sad burial feast
[SHK] Our solemn hymns to sullen dirges change
[SHK] Our bridal flowers serve for a buried corse
[SHK] And all things change them to the contrary
[SHK] Sir go you in and madam go with him
[SHK] And go Sir Paris every one prepare
[SHK] To follow this fair corse unto her grave
[SHK] The heavens do lour upon you for some ill
[SHK] Move them no more by crossing their high will
[SHK] Faith we may put up our pipes and be gone
[SHK] Honest goodfellows ah put up put up
[SHK] For well you know this is a pitiful case
[SHK] Ay by my troth the case may be amended
[SHK] Musicians O musicians 'Heart 's ease Heart 's
[SHK] ease O an you will have me live play 'Heart 's ease
[SHK] Why 'Heart 's ease
[SHK] O musicians because my heart itself plays 'My
[SHK] heart is full of woe O play me some merry dump
[SHK] to comfort me
[SHK] Not a dump we 't is no time to play now
[SHK] You will not then
[SHK] No
[SHK] I will then give it you soundly
[SHK] What will you give us
[SHK] No money on my faith but the gleek
[SHK] I will give you the minstrel
[SHK] Then I will give you the serving-creature
[SHK] Then will I lay the serving-creature 's dagger on
[SHK] your pate I will carry no crotchets I 'll re you
[SHK] I 'll fa you do you note me
[SHK] An you re us and fa us you note us
[SHK] Pray you put up your dagger and put out your wit
[SHK] Then have at you with my wit I will dry-beat you
[SHK] with an iron wit and put up my iron dagger Answer
[SHK] me like men
[SHK] 'When griping grief the heart doth wound
[SHK] And doleful dumps the mind oppress
[SHK] Then music with her silver sound --
[SHK] why 'silver sound why 'music with her silver
[SHK] sound What say you Simon Catling
[SHK] Marry sir because silver hath a sweet sound
[SHK] Pretty What say you Hugh Rebeck
[SHK] I say 'silver sound because musicians sound for silver
[SHK] Pretty too What say you James Soundpost
[SHK] Faith I know not what to say
[SHK] O I cry you mercy you are the singer I will say
[SHK] for you It is 'music with her silver sound
[SHK] because musicians have no gold for sounding
[SHK] 'Then music with her silver sound
[SHK] With speedy help doth lend redress
[SHK] What a pestilent knave is this same
[SHK] Hang him Jack Come we 'll in here tarry for the
[SHK] mourners and stay dinner
[SHK] If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep
[SHK] My dreams presage some joyful news at hand
[SHK] My bosom 's lord sits lightly in his throne
[SHK] And all this day an unaccustom 'd spirit
[SHK] Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts
[SHK] I dreamt my lady came and found me dead --
[SHK] Strange dream that gives a dead man leave
[SHK] to think --
[SHK] And breathed such life with kisses in my lips
[SHK] That I revived and was an emperor
[SHK] Ah me how sweet is love itself possess 'd
[SHK] When but love 's shadows are so rich in joy
[SHK] News from Verona -- How now Balthasar
[SHK] Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar
[SHK] How doth my lady Is my father well
[SHK] How fares my Juliet that I ask again
[SHK] For nothing can be ill if she be well
[SHK] Then she is well and nothing can be ill
[SHK] Her body sleeps in Capel 's monument
[SHK] And her immortal part with angels lives
[SHK] I saw her laid low in her kindred 's vault
[SHK] And presently took post to tell it you
[SHK] O pardon me for bringing these ill news
[SHK] Since you did leave it for my office sir
[SHK] Is it even so then I defy you stars
[SHK] Thou know'st my lodging get me ink and paper
[SHK] And hire post-horses I will hence to-night
[SHK] I do beseech you sir have patience
[SHK] Your looks are pale and wild and do import
[SHK] Some misadventure
[SHK] Tush thou art deceived
[SHK] Leave me and do the thing I bid thee do
[SHK] Hast thou no letters to me from the friar
[SHK] No my good lord
[SHK] No matter get thee gone
[SHK] And hire those horses I 'll be with thee straight
[SHK] Well Juliet I will lie with thee to-night
[SHK] Let 's see for means O mischief thou art swift
[SHK] To enter in the thoughts of desperate men
[SHK] I do remember an apothecary --
[SHK] And hereabouts he dwells -- which late I noted
[SHK] In tatter 'd weeds with overwhelming brows
[SHK] Culling of simples meagre were his looks
[SHK] Sharp misery had worn him to the bones
[SHK] And in his needy shop a tortoise hung
[SHK] An alligator stuff 'd and other skins
[SHK] Of ill-shaped fishes and about his shelves
[SHK] A beggarly account of empty boxes
[SHK] Green earthen pots bladders and musty seeds
[SHK] Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses
[SHK] Were thinly scatter 'd to make up a show
[SHK] Noting this penury to myself I said
[SHK] 'An if a man did need a poison now
[SHK] Whose sale is present death in Mantua
[SHK] Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him
[SHK] O this same thought did but forerun my need
[SHK] And this same needy man must sell it me
[SHK] As I remember this should be the house
[SHK] Being holiday the beggar 's shop is shut
[SHK] What ho apothecary
[SHK] Who calls so loud
[SHK] Come hither man I see that thou art poor
[SHK] Hold there is forty ducats let me have
[SHK] A dram of poison such soon-speeding gear
[SHK] As will disperse itself through all the veins
[SHK] That the life-weary taker may fall dead
[SHK] And that the trunk may be discharged of breath
[SHK] As violently as hasty powder fired
[SHK] Doth hurry from the fatal cannon 's womb
[SHK] Such mortal drugs I have but Mantua 's law
[SHK] Is death to any he that utters them
[SHK] Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness
[SHK] And fear'st to die famine is in thy cheeks
[SHK] Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes
[SHK] Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back
[SHK] The world is not thy friend nor the world 's law
[SHK] The world affords no law to make thee rich
[SHK] Then be not poor but break it and take this
[SHK] My poverty but not my will consents
[SHK] I pay thy poverty and not thy will
[SHK] Put this in any liquid thing you will
[SHK] And drink it off and if you had the strength
[SHK] Of twenty men it would dispatch you straight
[SHK] There is thy gold worse poison to men 's souls
[SHK] Doing more murders in this loathsome world
[SHK] Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell
[SHK] I sell thee poison thou hast sold me none
[SHK] Farewell buy food and get thyself in flesh
[SHK] Come cordial and not poison go with me
[SHK] To Juliet 's grave for there must I use thee
[SHK] Holy Franciscan friar brother ho
[SHK] This same should be the voice of Friar John
[SHK] Welcome from Mantua what says Romeo
[SHK] Or if his mind be writ give me his letter
[SHK] Going to find a bare-foot brother out
[SHK] One of our order to associate me
[SHK] Here in this city visiting the sick
[SHK] And finding him the searchers of the town
[SHK] Suspecting that we both were in a house
[SHK] Where the infectious pestilence did reign
[SHK] Seal 'd up the doors and would not let us forth
[SHK] So that my speed to Mantua there was stay 'd
[SHK] Who bare my letter then to Romeo
[SHK] I could not send it -- here it is again --
[SHK] Nor get a messenger to bring it thee
[SHK] So fearful were they of infection
[SHK] Unhappy fortune by my brotherhood
[SHK] The letter was not nice but full of charge
[SHK] Of dear import and the neglecting it
[SHK] May do much danger Friar John go hence
[SHK] Get me an iron crow and bring it straight
[SHK] Unto my cell
[SHK] Brother I 'll go and bring it thee
[SHK] Now must I to the monument alone
[SHK] Within three hours will fair Juliet wake
[SHK] She will beshrew me much that Romeo
[SHK] Hath had no notice of these accidents
[SHK] But I will write again to Mantua
[SHK] And keep her at my cell till Romeo come
[SHK] Poor living corse closed in a dead man 's tomb
[SHK] Give me thy torch boy hence and stand aloof
[SHK] Yet put it out for I would not be seen
[SHK] Under yond yew-trees lay thee all along
[SHK] Holding thine ear close to the hollow ground
[SHK] So shall no foot upon the churchyard tread
[SHK] Being loose unfirm with digging up of graves
[SHK] But thou shalt hear it whistle then to me
[SHK] As signal that thou hear'st something approach
[SHK] Give me those flowers Do as I bid thee go
[SHK] Here in the churchyard yet I will adventure
[SHK] Sweet flower with flowers thy bridal bed I strew --
[SHK] O woe thy canopy is dust and stones --
[SHK] Which with sweet water nightly I will dew
[SHK] Or wanting that with tears distill 'd by moans
[SHK] The obsequies that I for thee will keep
[SHK] Nightly shall be to strew thy grave and weep
[SHK] The boy gives warning something doth approach
[SHK] What cursed foot wanders this way to-night
[SHK] To cross my obsequies and true love 's rite
[SHK] What with a torch muffle me night awhile
[SHK] Give me that mattock and the wrenching iron
[SHK] Hold take this letter early in the morning
[SHK] See thou deliver it to my lord and father
[SHK] Give me the light upon thy life I charge thee
[SHK] Whate'er thou hear'st or seest stand all aloof
[SHK] And do not interrupt me in my course
[SHK] Why I descend into this bed of death
[SHK] Is partly to behold my lady 's face
[SHK] But chiefly to take thence from her dead finger
[SHK] A precious ring a ring that I must use
[SHK] In dear employment therefore hence be gone
[SHK] But if thou jealous dost return to pry
[SHK] In what I further shall intend to do
[SHK] By heaven I will tear thee joint by joint
[SHK] And strew this hungry churchyard with thy limbs
[SHK] The time and my intents are savage-wild
[SHK] More fierce and more inexorable far
[SHK] Than empty tigers or the roaring sea
[SHK] I will be gone sir and not trouble you
[SHK] So shalt thou show me friendship Take thou that
[SHK] Live and be prosperous and farewell good fellow
[SHK] His looks I fear and his intents I doubt
[SHK] Thou detestable maw thou womb of death
[SHK] Gorged with the dearest morsel of the earth
[SHK] Thus I enforce thy rotten jaws to open
[SHK] And in despite I 'll cram thee with more food
[SHK] This is that banish 'd haughty Montague
[SHK] That murder 'd my love 's cousin with which grief
[SHK] It is supposed the fair creature died
[SHK] And here is come to do some villanous shame
[SHK] To the dead bodies I will apprehend him
[SHK] Stop thy unhallow 'd toil vile Montague
[SHK] Can vengeance be pursued further than death
[SHK] Condemned villain I do apprehend thee
[SHK] Obey and go with me for thou must die
[SHK] I must indeed and therefore came I hither
[SHK] Good gentle youth tempt not a desperate man
[SHK] Fly hence and leave me think upon these gone
[SHK] Let them affright thee I beseech thee youth
[SHK] Put not another sin upon my head
[SHK] By urging me to fury O be gone
[SHK] By heaven I love thee better than myself
[SHK] For I come hither arm 'd against myself
[SHK] Stay not be gone live and hereafter say
[SHK] A madman 's mercy bade thee run away
[SHK] I do defy thy conjurations
[SHK] And apprehend thee for a felon here
[SHK] Wilt thou provoke me then have at thee boy
[SHK] O Lord they fight I will go call the watch
[SHK] O I am slain
[SHK] If thou be merciful
[SHK] Open the tomb lay me with Juliet
[SHK] In faith I will Let me peruse this face
[SHK] Mercutio 's kinsman noble County Paris
[SHK] What said my man when my betossed soul
[SHK] Did not attend him as we rode I think
[SHK] He told me Paris should have married Juliet
[SHK] Said he not so or did I dream it so
[SHK] Or am I mad hearing him talk of Juliet
[SHK] To think it was so O give me thy hand
[SHK] One writ with me in sour misfortune 's book
[SHK] I 'll bury thee in a triumphant grave
[SHK] A grave O no a lantern slaughter 'd youth
[SHK] For here lies Juliet and her beauty makes
[SHK] This vault a feasting presence full of light
[SHK] Death lie thou there by a dead man interr 'd
[SHK] How oft when men are at the point of death
[SHK] Have they been merry which their keepers call
[SHK] A lightning before death O how may I
[SHK] Call this a lightning O my love my wife
[SHK] Death that hath suck 'd the honey of thy breath
[SHK] Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty
[SHK] Thou art not conquer 'd beauty 's ensign yet
[SHK] Is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks
[SHK] And death 's pale flag is not advanced there
[SHK] Tybalt liest thou there in thy bloody sheet
[SHK] O what more favour can I do to thee
[SHK] Than with that hand that cut thy youth in twain
[SHK] To sunder his that was thine enemy
[SHK] Forgive me cousin Ah dear Juliet
[SHK] Why art thou yet so fair shall I believe
[SHK] That unsubstantial death is amorous
[SHK] And that the lean abhorred monster keeps
[SHK] Thee here in dark to be his paramour
[SHK] For fear of that I still will stay with thee
[SHK] And never from this palace of dim night
[SHK] Depart again here here will I remain
[SHK] With worms that are thy chamber-maids O here
[SHK] Will I set up my everlasting rest
[SHK] And shake the yoke of inauspicious stars
[SHK] From this world-wearied flesh Eyes look your last
[SHK] Arms take your last embrace and lips O you
[SHK] The doors of breath seal with a righteous kiss
[SHK] A dateless bargain to engrossing death
[SHK] Come bitter conduct come unsavoury guide
[SHK] Thou desperate pilot now at once run on
[SHK] The dashing rocks thy sea-sick weary bark
[SHK] Here 's to my love
[SHK] O true apothecary
[SHK] Thy drugs are quick Thus with a kiss I die
[SHK] Saint Francis be my speed how oft to-night
[SHK] Have my old feet stumbled at graves Who 's there
[SHK] Here 's one a friend and one that knows you well
[SHK] Bliss be upon you Tell me good my friend
[SHK] What torch is yond that vainly lends his light
[SHK] To grubs and eyeless skulls as I discern
[SHK] It burneth in the Capel 's monument
[SHK] It doth so holy sir and there 's my master
[SHK] One that you love
[SHK] Who is it
[SHK] Romeo
[SHK] How long hath he been there
[SHK] Full half an hour
[SHK] Go with me to the vault
[SHK] I dare not sir
[SHK] My master knows not but I am gone hence
[SHK] And fearfully did menace me with death
[SHK] If I did stay to look on his intents
[SHK] Stay then I 'll go alone Fear comes upon me
[SHK] O much I fear some ill unlucky thing
[SHK] As I did sleep under this yew-tree here
[SHK] I dreamt my master and another fought
[SHK] And that my master slew him
[SHK] Romeo
[SHK] Alack alack what blood is this which stains
[SHK] The stony entrance of this sepulchre
[SHK] What mean these masterless and gory swords
[SHK] To lie discolour 'd by this place of peace
[SHK] Romeo O pale Who else what Paris too
[SHK] And steep 'd in blood Ah what an unkind hour
[SHK] Is guilty of this lamentable chance
[SHK] The lady stirs
[SHK] O comfortable friar where is my lord
[SHK] I do remember well where I should be
[SHK] And there I am Where is my Romeo
[SHK] I hear some noise Lady come from that nest
[SHK] Of death contagion and unnatural sleep
[SHK] A greater power than we can contradict
[SHK] Hath thwarted our intents Come come away
[SHK] Thy husband in thy bosom there lies dead
[SHK] And Paris too Come I 'll dispose of thee
[SHK] Among a sisterhood of holy nuns
[SHK] Stay not to question for the watch is coming
[SHK] Come go good Juliet
[SHK] I dare no longer stay
[SHK] Go get thee hence for I will not away
[SHK] What 's here a cup closed in my true love 's hand
[SHK] Poison I see hath been his timeless end
[SHK] O churl drunk all and left no friendly drop
[SHK] To help me after I will kiss thy lips
[SHK] Haply some poison yet doth hang on them
[SHK] To make die with a restorative
[SHK] Thy lips are warm
[SHK] Yea noise then I 'll be brief O happy dagger
[SHK] This is thy sheath
[SHK] there rust and let me die
[SHK] This is the place there where the torch doth burn
[SHK] The ground is bloody search about the churchyard
[SHK] Go some of you whoe'er you find attach
[SHK] Pitiful sight here lies the county slain
[SHK] And Juliet bleeding warm and newly dead
[SHK] Who here hath lain these two days buried
[SHK] Go tell the prince run to the Capulets
[SHK] Raise up the Montagues some others search
[SHK] We see the ground whereon these woes do lie
[SHK] But the true ground of all these piteous woes
[SHK] We can not without circumstance descry
[SHK] Here 's Romeo 's man we found him in the churchyard
[SHK] Hold him in safety till the prince come hither
[SHK] Here is a friar that trembles sighs and weeps
[SHK] We took this mattock and this spade from him
[SHK] As he was coming from this churchyard side
[SHK] A great suspicion stay the friar too
[SHK] What misadventure is so early up
[SHK] That calls our person from our morning 's rest
[SHK] What should it be that they so shriek abroad
[SHK] The people in the street cry Romeo
[SHK] Some Juliet and some Paris and all run
[SHK] With open outcry toward our monument
[SHK] What fear is this which startles in our ears
[SHK] Sovereign here lies the County Paris slain
[SHK] And Romeo dead and Juliet dead before
[SHK] Warm and new kill 'd
[SHK] Search seek and know how this foul murder comes
[SHK] Here is a friar and slaughter 'd Romeo 's man
[SHK] With instruments upon them fit to open
[SHK] These dead men 's tombs
[SHK] O heavens O wife look how our daughter bleeds
[SHK] This dagger hath mista'en -- for lo his house
[SHK] Is empty on the back of Montague --
[SHK] And it mis-sheathed in my daughter 's bosom
[SHK] O me this sight of death is as a bell
[SHK] That warns my old age to a sepulchre
[SHK] Come Montague for thou art early up
[SHK] To see thy son and heir more early down
[SHK] Alas my liege my wife is dead to-night
[SHK] Grief of my son 's exile hath stopp 'd her breath
[SHK] What further woe conspires against mine age
[SHK] Look and thou shalt see
[SHK] O thou untaught what manners is in this
[SHK] To press before thy father to a grave
[SHK] Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while
[SHK] Till we can clear these ambiguities
[SHK] And know their spring their head their
[SHK] true descent
[SHK] And then will I be general of your woes
[SHK] And lead you even to death meantime forbear
[SHK] And let mischance be slave to patience
[SHK] Bring forth the parties of suspicion
[SHK] I am the greatest able to do least
[SHK] Yet most suspected as the time and place
[SHK] Doth make against me of this direful murder
[SHK] And here I stand both to impeach and purge
[SHK] Myself condemned and myself excused
[SHK] Then say at once what thou dost know in this
[SHK] I will be brief for my short date of breath
[SHK] Is not so long as is a tedious tale
[SHK] Romeo there dead was husband to that Juliet
[SHK] And she there dead that Romeo 's faithful wife
[SHK] I married them and their stol'n marriage-day
[SHK] Was Tybalt 's dooms-day whose untimely death
[SHK] Banish 'd the new-made bridegroom from the city
[SHK] For whom and not for Tybalt Juliet pined
[SHK] You to remove that siege of grief from her
[SHK] Betroth 'd and would have married her perforce
[SHK] To County Paris then comes she to me
[SHK] And with wild looks bid me devise some mean
[SHK] To rid her from this second marriage
[SHK] Or in my cell there would she kill herself
[SHK] Then gave I her so tutor 'd by my art
[SHK] A sleeping potion which so took effect
[SHK] As I intended for it wrought on her
[SHK] The form of death meantime I writ to Romeo
[SHK] That he should hither come as this dire night
[SHK] To help to take her from her borrow 'd grave
[SHK] Being the time the potion 's force should cease
[SHK] But he which bore my letter Friar John
[SHK] Was stay 'd by accident and yesternight
[SHK] Return 'd my letter back Then all alone
[SHK] At the prefixed hour of her waking
[SHK] Came I to take her from her kindred 's vault
[SHK] Meaning to keep her closely at my cell
[SHK] Till I conveniently could send to Romeo
[SHK] But when I came some minute ere the time
[SHK] Of her awaking here untimely lay
[SHK] The noble Paris and true Romeo dead
[SHK] She wakes and I entreated her come forth
[SHK] And bear this work of heaven with patience
[SHK] But then a noise did scare me from the tomb
[SHK] And she too desperate would not go with me
[SHK] But as it seems did violence on herself
[SHK] All this I know and to the marriage
[SHK] Her nurse is privy and if aught in this
[SHK] Miscarried by my fault let my old life
[SHK] Be sacrificed some hour before his time
[SHK] Unto the rigour of severest law
[SHK] We still have known thee for a holy man
[SHK] Where 's Romeo 's man what can he say in this
[SHK] I brought my master news of Juliet 's death
[SHK] And then in post he came from Mantua
[SHK] To this same place to this same monument
[SHK] This letter he early bid me give his father
[SHK] And threatened me with death going in the vault
[SHK] I departed not and left him there
[SHK] Give me the letter I will look on it
[SHK] Where is the county 's page that raised the watch
[SHK] Sirrah what made your master in this place
[SHK] He came with flowers to strew his lady 's grave
[SHK] And bid me stand aloof and so I did
[SHK] Anon comes one with light to ope the tomb
[SHK] And by and by my master drew on him
[SHK] And then I ran away to call the watch
[SHK] This letter doth make good the friar 's words
[SHK] Their course of love the tidings of her death
[SHK] And here he writes that he did buy a poison
[SHK] Of a poor 'pothecary and therewithal
[SHK] Came to this vault to die and lie with Juliet
[SHK] Where be these enemies Capulet Montague
[SHK] See what a scourge is laid upon your hate
[SHK] That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love
[SHK] And I for winking at your discords too
[SHK] Have lost a brace of kinsmen all are punish 'd
[SHK] O brother Montague give me thy hand
[SHK] This is my daughter 's jointure for no more
[SHK] Can I demand
[SHK] But I can give thee more
[SHK] For I will raise her statue in pure gold
[SHK] That while Verona by that name is known
[SHK] There shall no figure at such rate be set
[SHK] As that of true and faithful Juliet
[SHK] As rich shall Romeo 's by his lady 's lie
[SHK] Poor sacrifices of our enmity
[SHK] A glooming peace this morning with it brings
[SHK] The sun for sorrow will not show his head
[SHK] Go hence to have more talk of these sad things
[SHK] Some shall be pardon 'd and some punished
[SHK] For never was a story of more woe
[SHK] Than this of Juliet and her Romeo
